  9448 0000048D 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx

  9450                                  		;mov	si, offset month_tab
  9451 00000492 BE[F604]                		mov	si, month_tab	; 19/10/2022

  9455                                  months:

  9457                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9458 00000499 8A14                    		mov	dl, [si]	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:04B7h
  9459 0000049B 39D0                    		cmp	ax, dx		; cmp daycnt for each month till fit
  9460                                  					; dh=0
  9461 0000049D 7605                    		jbe	short month_done

  9463 000004A0 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx		; adjust daycnt

  9465                                  					; should never fall through loop

  9468                                  		;mov	byte [month_tab+1], 28
  9469                                  					; restore month table value
  9470 000004A9 88DA                    		mov	dl, bl
  9471 000004AB 8A36[F504]              		mov	dh, [base_year]
  9472 000004AF 8A0E[F404]              		mov	cl, [base_century] ; al=day,dl=month,dh=year,cl=cntry
  9473 000004B3 E81600                  		call	bintobcd	; convert "day"	to bcd
  9474                                  					; dl = bcd day,	al = month
  9475 000004B6 86D0                    		xchg	dl, al
  9476 000004B8 E81100                  		call	bintobcd	; dh = bcd month, al = year
  9477 000004BB 86F0                    		xchg	dh, al
  9478 000004BD E80C00                  		call	bintobcd	; cl = bcd year, al = century
  9479 000004C0 86C8                    		xchg	cl, al
  9480 000004C2 E80700                  		call	bintobcd	; ch = bcd century
  9481 000004C5 88C5                    		mov	ch, al
  9482 000004C7 8F06[F004]              		pop	word [daycnt] ; restore original value
  9483 000004CB C3                      		retn

  9486                                  
  9487                                  bintobcd:	; proc near		; real time clock support
  9488                                  
  9489                                  ;convert a binary input in al (less than 63h or 99 decimal)
  9490                                  ;into a bcd value in al. ah destroyed.	
  9491                                  		
  9492 000004CC D40A                    		aam			; AH = AL/10, AL = AL MOD 10
  9493 000004CE D510                    		aad     10h             ; db 0D5h,10h
  9494                                  					; AL = (AH*10H)+AL, AH = 0
  9495 000004D0 C3                      		retn

  9499                                  
  9500                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9501                                  
  9502                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9503                                  ; gettime reads date and time
  9504                                  ; and returns the following information:
  9505                                  ;
  9506                                  ;	es:[di]  =count of days since 1-1-80
  9507                                  ;	es:[di+2]=hours
  9508                                  ;	es:[di+3]=minutes
  9509                                  ;	es:[di+4]=seconds
  9510                                  ;	es:[di+5]=hundredths of seconds
  9511                                  ;
  9512                                  ;	NOTE:  Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9513                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9514                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9515                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9516                                  
  9517                                  tim_read:				; 2C7h:435h = 70h:29A5h
  9518 000004D1 E84B00                  		call	GetTickCnt
  9519 000004D4 8B36[F004]              		mov	si, [daycnt]
  9520                                  
  9521                                  ; we now need to convert the time in tick to the time in 100th of
  9522                                  ; seconds. the relation between tick and seconds is:
  9523                                  ;
  9524                                  ;		 65,536 seconds
  9525                                  ;	       ----------------
  9526                                  ;		1,193,180 tick
  9527                                  ;
  9528                                  ; to get to 100th of second we need to multiply by 100. the equation is:
  9529                                  ;
  9530                                  ;	ticks from clock  * 65,536 * 100
  9531                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9532                                  ;		1,193,180
  9533                                  ;
  9534                                  ; fortunately this formula simplifies to:
  9535                                  ;
  9536                                  ;	ticks from clock * 5 * 65,536
  9537                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9538                                  ;		59,659
  9539                                  ;
  9540                                  ; the calculation is done by first multipling tick by 5. next we divide by
  9541                                  ; 59,659. in this division we multiply by 65,536 by shifting the dividend
  9542                                  ; my 16 bits to the left.
  9543                                  ;
  9544                                  ; start with ticks in cx:dx
  9545                                  ; multiply by 5
  9546                                  
  9547 000004D8 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
  9548 000004DA 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; start	with ticks in cx:dx
  9549                                  					; multiply by 5
  9550 000004DC D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9551 000004DE D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	2
  9552 000004E0 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9553 000004E2 D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	4
  9554 000004E4 01DA                    		add	dx, bx
  9555 000004E6 11C8                    		adc	ax, cx		; times	5
  9556 000004E8 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9557                                  
  9558                                  ; now have ticks * 5 in	dx:ax
  9559                                  ; we now need to multiply by 65536 and divide by 59659 d.
  9560                                  
  9561 000004E9 B90BE9                  		mov	cx, 59659	; get divisor
  9562 000004EC F7F1                    		div	cx		; dx now has remainder
  9563                                  					; ax has high word of final quotient
  9564                                  
  9565                                  		; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  9566                                  		;mov	bx, ax		; put high word	in safe	place
  9567 000004EE 93                      		xchg	bx, ax
  9568 000004EF 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; this is the multiply by 65536
  9569 000004F1 F7F1                    		div	cx		; bx:ax	now has	time in	100th of seconds
  9570                                  
  9571                                  ; rounding based on the	remainder may be added here
  9572                                  ; the result in	bx:ax is time in 1/100 second.
  9573                                  
  9574 000004F3 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		
  9575 000004F5 B9C800                  		mov	cx, 200		; extract 1/100's
  9576                                  
  9577                                  ; division by 200 is necessary to ensure no overflow--max result
  9578                                  ; is number of seconds in a day/2 = 43200.
  9579                                  
  9580 000004F8 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9581 000004FA 80FA64                  		cmp	dl, 100		; remainder over 100?
  9582 000004FD 7203                    		jb	short noadj
  9583 000004FF 80EA64                  		sub	dl, 100		; keep 1/100's less than 100
  9584                                  noadj:					
  9585 00000502 F5                      		cmc			; if we	subtracted 100,	carry is now set
  9586 00000503 88D3                    		mov	bl, dl		; save 1/100's
  9587                                  
  9588                                  ; to compensate	for dividing by	200 instead of 100, we now multiply
  9589                                  ; by two, shifting a one in if the remainder had exceeded 100.
  9590                                  
  9591 00000505 D1D0                    		rcl	ax, 1		
  9592 00000507 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  9593 00000509 D1D2                    		rcl	dx, 1
  9594 0000050B B93C00                  		mov	cx, 60		; divide out seconds
  9595 0000050E F7F1                    		div	cx
  9596 00000510 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; save the seconds
  9597 00000512 F6F1                    		div	cl		; break	into hours and minutes
  9598 00000514 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah
  9599                                  
  9600                                  ; time is now in ax:bx (hours, minutes, seconds, 1/100 sec)
  9601                                  
  9602                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9603                                  		;push	ax
  9604                                  		;mov	ax, si		; daycnt
  9605 00000516 96                      		xchg	ax, si
  9606 00000517 AB                      		stosw
  9607                                  		;pop	ax
  9608 00000518 96                      		xchg	ax, si		; al = hours, ah = minutes
  9609 00000519 AB                      		stosw
  9610 0000051A 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  9611 0000051C AB                      		stosw
  9612 0000051D F8                      		clc			; [es:di] = count of days since 1-1-80
  9613                                  					;   [es:di+2] = hours
  9614                                  					;   [es:di+3] = minutes
  9615                                  					;   [es:di+4] = seconds
  9616                                  					;   [es:di+5] = hundredths of seconds
  9617 0000051E C3                      		retn
  9618                                  
  9619                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9620                                  
  9621                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9622                                  
  9623                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9624                                  ;
  9625                                  ; procedure : GetTickCnt
  9626                                  ;
  9627                                  ;		Returns the tick count in CX:DX. Takes care of DayCnt in case
  9628                                  ;		of rollover [except when power management driver is in use]. 
  9629                                  ;		Uses the following logic for updating Daycnt
  9630                                  ;
  9631                                  ;		if ( rollover ) {
  9632                                  ;			if ( t_switch )
  9633                                  ;				daycnt++ ;
  9634                                  ;			else
  9635                                  ;				daycnt += rollover ;
  9636                                  ;		}
  9637                                  ;
  9638                                  ; USES : AX
  9639                                  ;
  9640                                  ; RETURNS : CX:DX - tick count
  9641                                  ; MODIFIES : daycnt
  9642                                  ;
  9643                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9644                                  
  9645                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9646                                  GetTickCnt:	
  9647 0000051F 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  9648 00000521 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
  9649                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
  9650                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
  9651                                  					; midnight
  9652                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
  9653 00000523 803E[F204]00            		cmp	byte [t_switch], 0 ; use old method ? (>0 is yes)
  9654 00000528 7507                    		jnz	short inc_case	; old method assumes  that Int 1Ah returns rollover flag
  9655 0000052A 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; new method assumes that Int 1Ah returns roll over count
  9656                                  					; and not flag
  9657 0000052C 0106[F004]              		add	[daycnt], ax
  9658 00000530 C3                      		retn
  9659                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9660                                  
  9661                                  inc_case:				
  9662 00000531 08C0                    		or	al, al
  9663 00000533 7404                    		jz	short no_rollover
  9664 00000535 FF06[F004]              		inc	word [daycnt]
  9665                                  no_rollover:				
  9666 00000539 C3                      		retn
  9667

  9695                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9696                                  ;	disk interface routines
  9697                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9698                                  
  9699                                  ; device attribute bits:
  9700                                  ;	bit 6 - get/set map for logical drives and generic ioctl.
  9701                                  
  9702                                  ;MAXERR		equ	5
  9703                                  ;MAX_HD_FMT_ERR	equ	2
  9704                                  
  9705                                  ;LSTDRV	equ 504h
  9706                                  
  9707                                  ; some floppies do not have changeline. as a result, media-check would
  9708                                  ; normally return i-don't-know, the dos would continually reread the fat and
  9709                                  ; discard cached data. we optimize this by implementing a logical door-latch:
  9710                                  ; it is physically impossible to change a disk in under 2 seconds. we retain
  9711                                  ; the time of the last successful disk operation and compare it with the current
  9712                                  ; time during media-check. if < 2 seconds and at least 1 timer tick has passed,
  9713                                  ; the we say no change. if > 2 seconds then we say i-don't-know. finally, 
  9714                                  ; since we cannot trust the timer to be always available, we record the number 
  9715                                  ; of media checks that have occurred when no apparent time has elapsed. while
  9716                                  ; this number is < a given threshold, we say no change. when it exceeds that
  9717                                  ; threshold, we say i-don't-know and reset the counter to 0. when we store 
  9718                                  ; the time of last successful access, if we see that time has passed too,
  9719                                  ; we reset the counter.
  9720                                  
  9721                                  accessmax	equ	5
  9722                                  
  9723                                  ; due to various bogosities, we need to continually adjust what the head
  9724                                  ; settle time is.  the following algorithm is used:
  9725                                  ;
  9726                                  ;   get the current head settle value.
  9727                                  ;   if it is 0, then
  9728                                  ;	set slow = 15
  9729                                  ;   else
  9730                                  ;	set slow = value
  9731                                  ;   ...
  9732                                  ;*********************************************
  9733                                  ;************ old algorithm ******************
  9734                                  ;*   if we are seeking and writing then
  9735                                  ;*	 use slow
  9736                                  ;*   else
  9737                                  ;*	 use fast
  9738                                  ;*********************************************
  9739                                  ;*********** ibm's requested logic ***********
  9740                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing and not on an at then
  9741                                  ;	use slow
  9742                                  ;   else
  9743                                  ;	use fast
  9744                                  ;   ...
  9745                                  ;   restore current head settle value
  9746                                  ;
  9747                                  ;
  9748                                  ;---------------------------------------
  9749                                  multrk_on	equ	10000000b	;user spcified mutitrack=on, or system turns
  9750                                  					; it on after handling config.sys file as a
  9751                                  					; default value, if multrk_flag = multrk_off1.
  9752                                  multrk_off1	equ	00000000b	;initial value. no "multitrack=" command entered.
  9753                                  multrk_off2	equ	00000001b	;user specified multitrack=off.
  9754                                  
  9755                                  ; close data segment, open Bios_Code segment
  9756                                  
  9757                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9758                                  
  9759                                  ; BIOSCODE:04A2h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
  9760

  9763                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------

  9835                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9836                                  ; setdrive scans through the data structure of bdss, and returns a pointer to
  9837                                  ; the one that belongs to the drive specified. carry is set if none exists

  9949                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9950                                  
  9951                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9952                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
  9953                                  ; drive.
  9954                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
  9955                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
  9956                                  ; returns in si:
  9957                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
  9958                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
  9959                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
  9960                                  ;
  9961                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
  9962                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9963                                  
  9964                                  		; 19/10/2022

  9967 000005F9 E823FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
  9968 000005FC 268B4547                		mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
  9969                                  					; get stored time
  9970 00000600 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
  9971 00000602 268B4549                		mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
  9972 00000606 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
  9973                                  		; 11/08/2023
  9974                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0646h
  9975                                  		;mov	al, [accesscount]
  9976 00000608 7515                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
  9977 0000060A 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
  9978 0000060C 750C                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
  9979                                  		; 11/08/2023
  9980                                  		;inc	al
  9981                                  		;cmp	al, 5
  9982                                  		;;inc	byte [accesscount]
  9983                                  		;;cmp	byte [accesscount], 5 
  9984                                  		;			; if count is less than threshold, ok
  9985                                  		;jb	short timecheck_ret
  9986                                  		;;dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
  9987                                  		; 11/08/2023
  9988                                  		;dec	al
  9989                                  		;jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
  9990                                  		; 11/08/2023
  9991 0000060E 803E[1D01]04            		cmp	byte [accesscount], 4
  9992 00000613 730A                    		jnb	short timecheck_unk
  9993 00000615 FE06[1D01]              		inc	byte [accesscount]
  9994 00000619 C3                      		retn

  9996                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

  9998                                  timepassed:

 10000                                  					; min elapsed time? (2 seconds)

 10086                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------
 10087                                  ; clear ids in bds table. only applied for floppies.
 10088                                  ;input:  es:di -> bds table
 10089                                  ;	assumes ds: -> Bios_Data
 10090                                  ;output: volid set to "NO NAME    "
 10091                                  ;	 vol_serial set to 0.
 10092                                  ;	 filesys_id set to "FAT12   " or "FAT16   "
 10093                                  ;	   depending on the flag fatsize in bds.

 10095                                  ;	trashes si, cx

 10098                                  ;size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL equ 11

 10106                                  		; 11/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.1 IO.SYS (Optimization & BugFix)

 10125 0000067E 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 10126 00000681 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10127                                  		
 10128                                  		; 11/09/2023 (BugFix, DI is not start addr of BDS structure here)
 10129                                  		;;test	byte [es:di+BDS.fatsiz], fbig
 10130                                  		; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:05EFh)
 10131                                  		;test	byte [es:di+1Fh], 40h
 10132                                  
 10133                                  			; ! NOTE - 11/08/2023 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS bugfix)
 10134                                  			; Microsoft/IBM code has a bug here because the BDS's
 10135                                  			; .volid and .filesys_id fields will be reset
 10136                                  			; (to their default text) according to 'BDS.fatsiz' flags
 10137                                  			; at the BDS offset 31 but current (this) code checks flags
 10138                                  			; at ES:DI+31 while DI points the BDS offset 86!?
 10139                                  			;
 10140                                  			; Correct Code:
 10141                                  			; ;test byte [ES:31],40h or [ES:BDS.fatsiz],fbig
 10142                                  			; 11/09/2023
 10143                                  			; (before 'rep movsb') 'mov al,[es:di+BDS.Fatsiz]' and then
 10144                                  			; (after 'rep movsb') 'test al,fbig' (AL is free/proper to use here)	
 10145                                  			;
 10146                                  			; Same BUG is existing in PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:06C3h
 10147                                  			; and in Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0E1Ah as 'test byte [es:di+59],20h'
 10148                                  			; (PCDOS 7.1 BUG note: 26/06/2023)
 10149                                  			;
 10150                                  			; (Why this bug did not affect MSDOS and PCDOS 7.x applications:
 10151                                  			; 'clear_ids' is used for floppy disks only and the default
 10152                                  			; option of 'clear_ids' is FAT12 volid and filesys_id text
 10153                                  			; when the flag bit has wrong value for FAT16/40h or FAT32/20h.)
 10154                                  
 10155 00000683 A840                    		test	al, 40h ; * 
 10156

 10176                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10177                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
 10178                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
 10179                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
 10180                                  ;	    for all other cases,
 10181                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
 10182                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
 10183                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
 10184                                  ;
 10185                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
 10186                                  ;
 10187                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
 10188                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
 10189                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
 10190                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
 10191                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
 10192                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
 10193                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
 10194                                  ;
 10195                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
 10196                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
 10197                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
 10198                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10199                                  
 10200                                  GetBp:		; if returning fake bpb then return bpb as is.
 10201                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], return_fake_bpb|fnon_removable		
 10202 00000696 26F6452305              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 5
 10203 0000069B 7403                    		jz	short getbp1	; getbp1
 10204 0000069D E99A00                  		jmp	getret_exit
 10205                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10206                                  
 10207                                  getbp1:					
 10208 000006A0 51                      		push	cx
 10209 000006A1 52                      		push	dx
 10210 000006A2 53                      		push	bx
 10211                                  
 10212                                  		; attempt to read in boot sector and determine bpb.
 10213                                  		; we assume that the 2.x and greater dos disks all
 10214                                  		; have a valid boot sector.
 10215                                  
 10216 000006A3 E8A900                  		call	readbootsec
 10217 000006A6 7209                    		jb	short getbp_err_ret_brdg ; carry set if there was error.
 10218 000006A8 09DB                    		or	bx, bx		; bx is	0 if boot sector is valid.
 10219 000006AA 7508                    		jnz	short dofatbpb
 10220 000006AC E8EE00                  		call	movbpb		; move bpb into	registers
 10221 000006AF EB57                    		jmp	short Has1
 10222                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10223                                  
 10224                                  getbp_err_ret_brdg:			
 10225 000006B1 E98700                  		jmp	getbp_err_ret
 10226                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10227                                  
 10228                                  		; we have a 1.x diskette. In this case read in the fat ID byte
 10229                                  		; and fill in bpb from there.
 10230                                  dofatbpb:

 10365                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10366                                  
 10367                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10368                                  
 10369                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10370                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
 10371                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
 10372                                  ;
 10373                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
 10374                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10375                                  
 10376                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10377                                  
 10378                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 10379                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, BIOSCODE:06C3h)
 10380                                  
 10381                                  readbootsec:	
 10382 0000074F B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
 10383 00000751 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
 10384 00000754 E8BF00                  		call	read_sector
 10385 00000757 7243                    		jb	short err_ret
 10386 00000759 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
 10387                                  
 10388                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
 10389                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
 10390                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
 10391                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
 10392                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
 10393                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
 10394                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
 10395                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
 10396                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
 10397                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
 10398                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
 10399                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
 10400                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
 10401                                  		; informations
 10402                                  
 10403                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
 10404                                  
 10405                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10406                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10407                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
 10408                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
 10409                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
 10410                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
 10411                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
 10412                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10413                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 10414                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10415                                  
 10416                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 10417 0000075B A0[4E01]                		mov	al, [disksector]
 10418 0000075E 3C69                    		cmp	al, 69h		; is it a direct jump?
 10419 00000760 740F                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 10420                                  					; don't need to find a nop
 10421 00000762 3CE9                    		cmp	al, 0E9h	; dos 2.0 jump?
 10422 00000764 740B                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 10423                                  					; no need for nop
 10424 00000766 3CEB                    		cmp	al, 0EBh	; how about a short jump?
 10425 00000768 7530                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 10426 0000076A 803E[5001]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 10427 0000076F 7529                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 10428                                  
 10429                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10430                                  ;
 10431                                  ;; 10/03/2019
 10432                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
 10433                                  ;;
 10434                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
 10435                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
 10436                                  ;;
 10437                                  ;;check_signature:
 10438                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
 10439                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
 10440                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if singled sided medium.
 10441                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
 10442                                  
 10443                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
 10444                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
 10445                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
 10446                                  
 10447                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10448                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:
 10449 00000771 A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10450                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10451 00000774 50                      		push	ax ; 02/09/2023
 10452 00000775 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
 10453 00000777 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
 10454 00000779 58                      		pop	ax ; 02/09/2023
 10455 0000077A 751E                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10456                                  
 10457                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
 10458                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
 10459                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
 10460                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
 10461                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
 10462                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
 10463                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
 10464                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
 10465                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
 10466                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
 10467                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
 10468                                  
 10469                                  checksinglesided:
 10470                                  		;mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10471                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10472                                  		; al = [disksector+15h]
 10473 0000077C 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
 10474 0000077E 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
 10475 00000780 A801                    		test	al, 1
 10476 00000782 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
 10477 00000784 813E[5601]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
 10478 0000078A 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
 10479 0000078C 803E[5801]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
 10480 00000791 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
 10481                                  
 10482                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
 10483                                  
 10484                                  mustbeearlier:				
 10485 00000793 C606[5B01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
 10486                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10487 00000798 EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
 10488                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10489                                  
 10490                                  invalidbootsec:				
 10491 0000079A 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
 10492                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10493                                  movbpb_ret:
 10494                                  gooddsk:				
 10495 0000079B F8                      		clc

 10497 0000079C C3                      		retn

 10504                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10505                                  
 10506                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10507                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10508                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
 10509                                  ; getbp routine at has1
 10510                                  ;
 10511                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
 10512                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
 10513                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
 10514                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
 10515                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
 10516                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
 10517                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10518                                  
 10519                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10520                                  
 10521                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10522                                  movbpb:	
 10523 0000079D 8A36[5B01]              		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
 10524                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10525                                  					; sectors per unit
 10526 000007A1 8A3E[5F01]              		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
 10527                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
 10528                                  					; number of directory entries
 10529 000007A5 8B0E[6101]              		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
 10530                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
 10531                                  					; size of drive
 10532 000007A9 8A26[6301]              		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
 10533                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10534                                  					; media	descriptor
 10535 000007AD A0[6401]                		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
 10536                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
 10537                                  					; number of fat	sectors
 10538 000007B0 8A1E[6601]              		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
 10539                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
 10540                                  					; sectors per track
 10541 000007B4 8A16[6801]              		mov	dl, [disksector+1Ah]
 10542                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.HEADS]
 10543                                  					; number of heads
 10544 000007B8 803E[0205]01            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 1 ; called by get_bpb?
 10545 000007BD 75DC                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10546 000007BF E81200                  		call	mov_media_ids
 10547 000007C2 7205                    		jb	short movbpb_conv ; conventional boot record?
 10548 000007C4 C606[0205]02            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 2 ; signals that volume id is set
 10549                                  movbpb_conv:				
 10550 000007C9 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1
 10551 000007CE 75CB                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
 10552 000007D0 E8B511                  		call	resetchanged	; reset	flags in bds to	not fchanged.
 10553                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10554                                  		; cf = 0
 10555                                  ;movbpb_ret:				
 10556                                  		;clc
 10557 000007D3 C3                      		retn
 10558                                  
 10559                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10560                                  
 10561                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
 10562                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
 10563                                  ;by es:di.
 10564                                  
 10565                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
 10566                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.
 10567                                  ;out.) vol_serial, bds_volid and bds_system_id in bds are set according to
 10568                                  ;      the boot record information.
 10569                                  ;     carry flag set if not an extended bpb.
 10570                                  ;     all registers saved except the flag.
 10571                                  
 10572                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10573                                  mov_media_ids:		
 10574 000007D4 803E[7401]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h
 10575                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG],
 10576                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
 10577 000007D9 752C                    		jnz	short mmi_not_ext
 10578 000007DB 51                      		push	cx
 10579 000007DC 8B0E[7501]              		mov	cx, [disksector+27h]
 10580                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]
 10581 000007E0 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
 10582 000007E4 8B0E[7701]              		mov	cx, [disksector+29h]
 10583                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL+2]
 10584 000007E8 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
 10585 000007EC 57                      		push	di
 10586 000007ED 56                      		push	si
 10587 000007EE B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10588 000007F1 BE[7901]                		mov	si, disksector+2Bh
 10589                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+2Bh) ;
 10590                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.VOL_LABEL
 10591 000007F4 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 10592 000007F7 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10593                                  		;mov	cx, 8		; size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
 10594                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10595 000007F9 B108                    		mov	cl, 8 ; cx = 8
 10596 000007FB BE[8401]                		mov	si, disksector+36h
 10597                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+36h) ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.SYSTEM_ID
 10598 000007FE 83C705                  		add	di, 5		; (BDS.filesys_id-BDS.volid)-size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10599 00000801 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10600 00000803 5E                      		pop	si
 10601 00000804 5F                      		pop	di
 10602 00000805 59                      		pop	cx
 10603                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10604                                  		; cf = 0
 10605                                  		;clc		; this clc is not required (16/06/2019 - Erdogan Tan)
 10606                                  				; (20/09/2022)
 10607 00000806 C3                      		retn
 10608                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10609                                  
 10610                                  mmi_not_ext:				
 10611 00000807 F9                      		stc
 10612 00000808 C3                      		retn

 10614                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10615                                  
 10616                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10617                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10618                                  ; read in the fat sector and get the media byte from it.
 10619                                  ; input : es:di -> bds
 10620                                  ; output:
 10621                                  ;	  carry set if an error occurs, ax contains error code.
 10622                                  ;	  otherwise, ah contains media byte on exit
 10623                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10624                                  
 10625                                  readfat:	
 10626                                  		;mov	dh, 0
 10627                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10628 00000809 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
 10629 0000080B B90200                  		mov	cx, 2		; head 0
 10630                                  					; cylinder 0, sector 2
 10631 0000080E E80500                  		call	read_sector
 10632 00000811 7202                    		jb	short bad_fat_ret
 10633 00000813 8A27                    		mov	ah, [bx]	; media	byte
 10634                                  bad_fat_ret:

 10636                                  
 10637                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10638                                  
 10639                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10640                                  
 10641                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10642                                  ; read a single sector into the temp buffer.
 10643                                  ; perform three retries in case of error.
 10644                                  ;   inputs:	es:[di].bds_drivenum has physical drive to use
 10645                                  ;		cx has sector and cylinder
 10646                                  ;		dh has head
 10647                                  ;		es:di has bds
 10648                                  ;		ds has Bios_Data
 10649                                  ;
 10650                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear
 10651                                  ;		    Bios_Data:bx point to sector
 10652                                  ;		       (note: some callers assume location of buffer)
 10653                                  ;
 10654                                  ;		carry set
 10655                                  ;		    ax has rom error code
 10656                                  ;
 10657                                  ; register bp is preserved.
 10658                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10659                                  
 10660                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10661                                  
 10662                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10663                                  read_sector:	
 10664 00000816 55                      		push	bp
 10665 00000817 BD0300                  		mov	bp, 3		; make 3 attempts
 10666 0000081A 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10667 0000081E BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; get es:bx to point to	buffer
 10668                                  rd_ret:					
 10669 00000821 06                      		push	es
 10670 00000822 1E                      		push	ds
 10671 00000823 07                      		pop	es
 10672 00000824 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10673 00000827 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10674                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10675                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10676                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10677 00000829 07                      		pop	es
 10678 0000082A 734A                    		jnb	short okret2
 10679                                  rd_rty:					
 10680 0000082C E87404                  		call	again		; reset	disk, decrement	bp, preserve ax
 10681 0000082F 7442                    		jz	short err_rd_ret
 10682 00000831 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 10683                                  		;test	byte ptr [es:di+23h], 1	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10684                                  					; fnon_removable
 10685 00000836 75E9                    		jnz	short rd_ret
 10686 00000838 803E[3006]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10687 0000083D 7510                    		jnz	short rd_skip1_dpt
 10688 0000083F 50                      		push	ax
 10689 00000840 1E                      		push	ds		; for retry, set the head settle time to 0Fh
 10690 00000841 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10691                                  		;mov	al, [si+9]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10692                                  		;mov	byte [si+9], 15 ; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10693                                  		;			; NORMSETTLE
 10694                                  		; 12/12/2022
 10695 00000845 B00F                    		mov	al, 15
 10696 00000847 864409                  		xchg	al, [si+9]
 10697                                  		; 
 10698 0000084A 1F                      		pop	ds
 10699 0000084B A2[2A01]                		mov	[save_head_sttl], al
 10700 0000084E 58                      		pop	ax
 10701                                  rd_skip1_dpt:				
 10702 0000084F 06                      		push	es
 10703 00000850 1E                      		push	ds
 10704 00000851 07                      		pop	es
 10705 00000852 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10706 00000855 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10707                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10708                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10709                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10710 00000857 07                      		pop	es
 10711 00000858 9C                      		pushf
 10712 00000859 803E[3006]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10713 0000085E 750E                    		jnz	short rd_skip2_dpt
 10714 00000860 50                      		push	ax
 10715 00000861 A0[2A01]                		mov	al, [save_head_sttl]
 10716 00000864 1E                      		push	ds
 10717 00000865 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10718 00000869 884409                  		mov	[si+9],	al	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10719 0000086C 1F                      		pop	ds
 10720 0000086D 58                      		pop	ax
 10721                                  rd_skip2_dpt:				
 10722 0000086E 9D                      		popf
 10723 0000086F 7305                    		jnb	short okret2
 10724 00000871 EBB9                    		jmp	short rd_rty
 10725                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10726                                  
 10727                                  err_rd_ret:

 10729                                  					; return error
 10730 00000875 F9                      		stc
 10731                                  
 10732                                  ; update information pertaining to last drive accessed, time of access, last
 10733                                  ; track accessed in that drive.
 10734                                  
 10735                                  okret2:

 10743 00000886 9D                      		popf			; restore flags

 10771                                  exitjx:

 10840                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10841                                  ; miscellaneous odd jump routines. 
 10842                                  ; moved out of mainline for speed.
 10843                                  
 10844                                  ; if we have a system where we have virtual drives, we need 
 10845                                  ; to prompt the user to place the correct disk in the drive.
 10846                                  ;
 10847                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds:->Bios_Data
 10848                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10849                                  
 10850                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10851                                  checksingle:		
 10852 000008D8 50                      		push	ax
 10853 000008D9 53                      		push	bx
 10854 000008DA 268B5D23                		mov	bx, [es:di+23h]	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10855                                  
 10856                                  ; if hard drive, cannot change disk.
 10857                                  ; if current owner of physical drive, no need to change diskette.
 10858                                  
 10859 000008DE F6C321                  		test	bl, 21h		; fnon_removable|fi_own_physical
 10860 000008E1 7573                    		jnz	short singleret
 10861 000008E3 F6C310                  		test	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 10862                                  					; is there a drive sharing this	physical drive?
 10863 000008E6 746E                    		jz	short singleret
 10864                                  
 10865                                  
 10866                                  ; look for the previous owner of this physical drive
 10867                                  ; and reset its ownership flag.
 10868                                  
 10869 000008E8 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10870                                  					; get physical drive number
 10871 000008EC 06                      		push	es		; preserve pointer to current bds
 10872 000008ED 57                      		push	di
 10873 000008EE C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; get first bds
 10874                                  scan_list:				
 10875 000008F2 26384504                		cmp	[es:di+4], al
 10876 000008F6 7553                    		jnz	short scan_skip	; Not our drive. Try next bds.
 10877 000008F8 B320                    		mov	bl, 20h	; ' '   ; fi_own_physical ; test ownership flag
 10878 000008FA 26845D23                		test	[es:di+23h], bl
 10879 000008FE 744B                    		jz	short scan_skip	; he doesn't own it either. continue
 10880 00000900 26305D23                		xor	[es:di+23h], bl	; reset	ownership flag
 10881 00000904 5F                      		pop	di		; restore pointer to current bds
 10882 00000905 07                      		pop	es
 10883 00000906 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; ; set	ownership flag
 10884                                  
 10885                                  ; we examine the fsetowner flag. if it is set, then we are using the code in
 10886                                  ; checksingle to just set the owner of a drive. we must not issue the prompt
 10887                                  ; in this case.
 10888 0000090A 803E[7A00]01            		cmp	byte [fsetowner], 1
 10889 0000090F 7517                    		jnz	short not_fsetowner
 10890                                  		;cmp	byte ptr es:[di+4], 0 ;	are we handling	drive number 0 ?
 10891 00000911 26807D0400              		cmp	byte [es:di+4], 0
 10892 00000916 753E                    		jnz	short singleret
 10893 00000918 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]
 10894                                  		;mov	al, es:[di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 10895                                  					; get the DOS drive letter
 10896 0000091C 06                      		push	es
 10897 0000091D 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10898 00000921 26A20405                		mov	[es:LSTDRV], al
 10899                                  		;mov	es:504h, al	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10900                                  					; set up sdsb
 10901 00000925 07                      		pop	es		; restore bds pointer
 10902 00000926 EB2E                    		jmp	short singleret
 10903                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10904                                  
 10905                                  ; to support "backward" compatibility with ibm's "single drive status byte"
 10906                                  ; we now check to see if we are in a single drive system and the application
 10907                                  ; has "cleverly" diddled the sdsb
 10908                                  
 10909                                  not_fsetowner:

 10911 0000092D 7517                    		jnz	short ignore_sdsb
 10912 0000092F 50                      		push	ax
 10913 00000930 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; if (curr_drv == req_drv)
 10914 00000934 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 10915 00000936 06                      		push	es
 10916 00000937 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10917 0000093B 2686060405              		xchg	al, [es:LSTDRV]
 10918                                  		;xchg	al, es:504h	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10919                                  					; then swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 10920 00000940 07                      		pop	es
 10921 00000941 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; else
 10922 00000943 58                      		pop	ax		; swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 10923 00000944 7410                    		jz	short singleret	; issue	swap_dsk_msg
 10924                                  ignore_sdsb:

 10928                                  
 10929                                  scan_skip:

 10932                                  					; go to	next bds
 10933 0000094E 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; end of list?
 10934 00000951 759F                    		jnz	short scan_list	; ontinue until	hit end	of list
 10935 00000953 F9                      		stc
 10936 00000954 5F                      		pop	di		; restore current bds
 10937 00000955 07                      		pop	es
 10938                                  
 10939                                  singleret:

 10962                                  ; 15/10/52022
 10963                                  
 10964                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10965                                  ;	disk i/o handler
 10966                                  ;
 10967                                  ;	al = drive number (0-6)
 10968                                  ;	ah = media descriptor
 10969                                  ;	cx = sector count
 10970                                  ;	dx = first sector (low)
 10971                                  ;	[start_sec_h] = first sector (high)  32 bit calculation.
 10972                                  ;	ds = cs
 10973                                  ;	es:di = transfer address
 10974                                  ;	[rflag]=operation (2=read, 3=write)
 10975                                  ;	[verify]=1 for verify after write
 10976                                  ;
 10977                                  ;	if successful carry flag = 0
 10978                                  ;	  else cf=1 and al contains error code
 10979                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10980                                  
 10981                                  diskrd:	
 10982                                  		;mov	ds:rflag, 2	; romread
 10983                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10984 00000961 C606[2001]02            		mov	byte [rflag], 2 ; romread
 10985                                  
 10986                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10987                                  
 10988                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10989                                  diskio:
 10990 00000966 89FB                    		mov	bx, di		; es:bx	= transfer address
 10991 00000968 8C06[2F05]              		mov	[xfer_seg], es	; save transfer	segment
 10992 0000096C E801FC                  		call	SetDrive
 10993 0000096F 268A4510                		mov	al, [es:di+10h]	; [es:di+BDS.media]
 10994 00000973 A2[1F01]                		mov	[medbyt], al
 10995                                  		;jcxz	short ioret
 10996 00000976 E3E8                    		jcxz	ioret
 10997                                  
 10998                                  ; see if the media is formatted or not by checking the flags field in
 10999                                  ; in the bds. if it is unformatted we cannot allow i/o, so we should
 11000                                  ; go to the error exit at label unformatteddrive.
 11001                                  
 11002 00000978 26F6452402              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 2
 11003                                  		;test	byte ptr es:[di+24h], 2	; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
 11004                                  					; unformatted_media
 11005 0000097D 75DE                    		jnz	short unformatteddrive
 11006 0000097F 890E[2201]              		mov	[seccnt], cx	; save sector count
 11007 00000983 8926[3501]              		mov	[spsav], sp	; save sp
 11008                                  
 11009                                  ; ensure that we are trying to access valid sectors on the drive
 11010                                  
 11011 00000987 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
 11012 00000989 31F6                    		xor	si, si
 11013 0000098B 01CA                    		add	dx, cx
 11014                                  		;adc	si, 0
 11015                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 11016 0000098D D1D6                    		rcl	si, 1
 11017 0000098F 26837D0E00              		cmp	word [es:di+0Eh], 0 ; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 11018                                  					; 32 bit sector ?
 11019 00000994 740C                    		jz	short sanity32
 11020                                  		;cmp	si, 0
 11021                                  		; 02/09/2023
 11022 00000996 09F6                    		or	si, si
 11023 00000998 75BF                    		jnz	short baddrive
 11024 0000099A 263B550E                		cmp	dx, [es:di+0Eh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 11025 0000099E 77B9                    		ja	short baddrive
 11026 000009A0 EB12                    		jmp	short sanityok
 11027                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11028                                  
 11029                                  sanity32:				
 11030 000009A2 0336[2305]              		add	si, [start_sec_h]
 11031 000009A6 263B751D                		cmp	si, [es:di+1Dh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
 11032 000009AA 7208                    		jb	short sanityok
 11033 000009AC 77AB                    		ja	short baddrive
 11034 000009AE 263B551B                		cmp	dx, [es:di+1Bh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32]
 11035 000009B2 77A5                    		ja	short baddrive
 11036                                  
 11037                                  sanityok:				
 11038 000009B4 8B16[2305]              		mov	dx, [start_sec_h]
 11039 000009B8 26034517                		add	ax, [es:di+17h]	; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs]
 11040 000009BC 26135519                		adc	dx, [es:di+19h]	; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
 11041                                  
 11042                                  ; now dx;ax have the physical first sector.
 11043                                  ; since the following procedures is going to destroy ax, let's
 11044                                  ; save it temporarily to saved_word.
 11045                                  
 11046 000009C0 A3[2505]                		mov	[saved_word], ax ; save the sector number (low)
 11047                                  
 11048                                  ; set up pointer to disk base table in [dpt]. we cannot assume that iosetup
 11049                                  ; will do it because we will skip the set up stuff with hard disks.
 11050                                  
 11051 000009C3 06                      		push	es
 11052                                  		;mov	es, [zeroseg]
 11053                                  		; 02/09/2023
 11054 000009C4 31F6                    		xor	si, si ; 0
 11055 000009C6 8EC6                    		mov	es, si
 11056 000009C8 26C4367800              		les	si, [es:DSKADR]
 11057                                  		;les	si, es:78h	; [es:DSKADR]
 11058                                  					; current disk parm table
 11059 000009CD 8936[2D01]              		mov	[dpt], si
 11060 000009D1 8C06[2F01]              		mov	[dpt+2], es
 11061 000009D5 07                      		pop	es
 11062 000009D6 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 11063                                  					; fnon_removable
 11064 000009DB 7510                    		jnz	short skip_setup
 11065 000009DD E8F8FE                  		call	checksingle
 11066                                  
 11067                                  ; check to see if we have previously noted a change line. the routine
 11068                                  ; returns if everything is ok. otherwise, it pops off the stack and returns
 11069                                  ; the proper error code.
 11070                                  
 11071 000009E0 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0 ; do we have changeline support?
 11072 000009E5 7403                    		jz	short diskio_nochangeline ; brif not
 11073 000009E7 E8960E                  		call	checklatchio	; will do a sneaky pop stack return
 11074                                  					; if a disk error occurs
 11075                                  diskio_nochangeline:			
 11076 000009EA E84700                  		call	iosetup		; set up tables	and variables for i/o
 11077                                  
 11078                                  ; now the settle values are correct for the following code

 11304                                  		 ; 19/10/2022

 11342                                  					; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]

 11345                                  
 11346                                  ; if we have [step_drv] set to -1, we use the slow settle time.

 11359

 11363                                  do_fast:

 11365

 11379                                  
 11380                                  ; check the flags word in the bds to see if the drive is non removable

 11413                                  
 11414                                  ; 15/10/2022

 11416                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 11417                                  ; the request is for write. determine if we are talking about
 11418                                  ; the same track and drive. if so, use the fast speed.

 11441 00000BC2 73A5                    		jnb	short noverify
 11442                                  
 11443                                  ; check the error returned in ah to see if it is a soft ecc error.
 11444                                  ; if it is not we needn't do anything special. if it is a soft
 11445                                  ; ecc error then decrement the soft_ecc_cnt error retry count. if
 11446                                  ; this retry count becomes 0 then we just ignore the error and go to

 11457

 11507                                  ; entry point for routines that call maperror themselves
 11508                                  
 11509                                  harderr:

 11511                                  harderr2:

 11513                                  					; force a media check through rom

 11515 00000C27 8B26[3501]              		mov	sp, [spsav]	; recover entry	stack pointer
 11516                                  
 11517                                  ; since we are performing a non-local goto, restore the disk parameters
 11518                                  
 11519                                  		;jmp	diddleback

 11521 00000C2B E958FE                  		jmp	diddle_back
 11522                                  
 11523                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11524                                  
 11525                                  ; change settle value from settlecurrent to whatever is appropriate
 11526                                  ; note that this routine is never called for a fixed disk.
 11527                                  
 11528                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11529                                  normspeed:
 11530 00000C2E 803E[3006]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 11531 00000C33 751E                    		jnz	short fastspeed
 11532 00000C35 06                      		push	es
 11533 00000C36 50                      		push	ax

 11536 00000C3E 26884409                		mov	[es:si+9], al	; [es:si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 11537 00000C42 58                      		pop	ax
 11538 00000C43 07                      		pop	es

 11540 00000C47 06                      		push	es
 11541 00000C48 C436[2D01]              		les	si, [dpt]
 11542 00000C4C 26C6440901              		mov	byte [es:si+9], 1 ; [es:si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 11543                                  					; 1 is fast settle value
 11544 00000C51 07                      		pop	es
 11545 00000C52 C3                      		retn
 11546                                  
 11547                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11548                                  
 11549                                  ; if the drive has been marked as too big (i.e. starting sector of the
 11550                                  ; partition is > 16 bits, then always return drive not ready.
 11551                                  
 11552                                  fastspeed:

 11554                                  					; ftoobig
 11555 00000C58 750D                    		jnz	short notready
 11556 00000C5A 06                      		push	es
 11557 00000C5B 8E06[2F05]              		mov	es, [xfer_seg]
 11558 00000C5F CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK -
 11559 00000C61 8C06[2F05]              		mov	[xfer_seg], es
 11560 00000C65 07                      		pop	es
 11561 00000C66 C3                      		retn

 11564                                  notready:

 11568                                  
 11569                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11570                                  
 11571                                  ; map error returned by rom in ah into corresponding code to be returned to
 11572                                  ; dos in al. trashes di. guaranteed to set carry.
 11573                                  
 11574                                  maperror:	
 11575 00000C6B 51                      		push	cx
 11576 00000C6C 06                      		push	es
 11577 00000C6D 1E                      		push	ds		; set es=Bios_Data
 11578 00000C6E 07                      		pop	es
 11579 00000C6F 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; put error code in al
 11580 00000C71 A2[4401]                		mov	[lsterr], al	; terminate list with error code
 11581                                  		;mov	cx, 11 ; PCDOS 7.1 ; 02/09/2023
 11582 00000C74 B90900                  		mov	cx, 9		; numerr (= errout-errin)
 11583                                  					; number of possible error conditions
 11584 00000C77 BF[3C01]                		mov	di, errin	; point to error conditions
 11585 00000C7A F2AE                    		repne scasb
 11586                                  		; 02/09/2023
 11587                                  		;mov	al, [di+10] ; PCDOS 7.1
 11588                                  		; 10/12/2022
 11589 00000C7C 8A4508                  		mov	al, [di+8]	; [di+numerr-1]
 11590                                  					; get translation
 11591                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary ! 
 11592                                  		;db	8Ah, 85h, 8, 0	; mov al, [di+8]
