 13363                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13364                                  ; Ioctl_Support_Query
 13365                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13366                                  ;
 13367                                  ; New device command which was added in DOS 5.00 to allow a query of a 
 13368                                  ; specific GENERIC IOCtl to see if it is supported. Bit 7 in the
 13369                                  ; device attributes specifies if this function is supported.
 13370                                  ;
 13371                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13372                                  
 13373                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13374                                  ioctl_support_query:
 13375 000012E2 06                      		push	es
 13376 000012E3 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]	; ES:BX Points to request header.
 13377 000012E7 268B470D                		mov	ax, [es:bx+13]	; [es:bx+IOCTL_REQ.MAJORFUNCTION]
 13378                                  					; AL ==	Major, AH == Minor
 13379                                  
 13380                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 13381                                  		;cmp	al, 48h		; IOC_NEW_DC (PCDOS 7.1)
 13382                                  		;			; new generic ioctl function (FAT32)
 13383                                  		;jz	short ioctl_support
 13384                                  
 13385 000012EB 3C08                    		cmp	al, 8		; IOC_DC
 13386                                  					; See if major code is 8
 13387 000012ED 7513                    		jnz	short nosupport
 13388                                  ioctl_support:
 13389 000012EF 0E                      		push	cs
 13390 000012F0 07                      		pop	es
 13391                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13392                                  		;mov	cx, 14          ; (PCDOS 7.1) IOC_DC_TABLE_LEN
 13393 000012F1 B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; IOC_DC_TABLE_LEN
 13394                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13395 000012F4 BF[D50C]                		mov	di, IOC_DC_Table
 13396                                  		;mov	di, 0C60h	; IOC_DC_Table
 13397                                  					; at 2C7h:0C60h	= 70h:31D0h
 13398 000012F7 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah		; Put minor code in AL
 13399 000012F9 F2AE                    		repne scasb		; Scan for minor code in AL
 13400 000012FB 7505                    		jnz	short nosupport	; it was not found
 13401 000012FD B80001                  		mov	ax, 100h
 13402                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13403                                  		; (jump to ioctlsupexit is not required)
 13404                                  		;jmp	short $+2	; ioctlsupexit
 13405                                  					; Signal ioctl is supported
 13406                                  		;;jmp	short ioctlsupexit
 13407                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13408                                  ioctlsupexit:
 13409 00001300 07                      		pop	es
 13410                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13411                                  		; cf = 0
 13412                                  		;clc
 13413 00001301 C3                      		retn
 13414                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13415                                  nosupport:
 13416 00001302 07                      		pop	es
 13417 00001303 E9D3ED                  		jmp	bc_cmderr
 13418                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13419                                  
 13420                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13421                                  
 13422                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13423                                  ;	GetMediaSenseStatus
 13424                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13425                                  ;
 13426                                  ; FUNCTION: Will return the type of diskette media in the specified DOS
 13427                                  ;	    diskette drive and whether the media is the default type
 13428                                  ;	    for that drive. (default type means the max size for that
 13429                                  ;	    drive)
 13430                                  ;
 13431                                  ; INPUT :   ES:DI -> BDS table
 13432                                  ; OUTPUT:   If carry clear
 13433                                  ;	    DS:BX -> Updated IOCtlPacket
 13434                                  ;
 13435                                  ;			 Special Function at offset 0:
 13436                                  ;				0	- Media detected is not default type
 13437                                  ;				1	- Media detected is default type
 13438                                  ;
 13439                                  ;			 Device Type at offset 1:
 13440                                  ;				2       - 720K 3.5" 80 tracks
 13441                                  ;				7	- 1.44M 3.5" 80 tracks
 13442                                  ;				9	- 2.88M 3.5" 80 tracks
 13443                                  ;
 13444                                  ; Error Codes returned in AX if carry set:
 13445                                  ;
 13446                                  ; 8102 - Drive not ready	- No disk is in the drive.
 13447                                  ; 8107 - Unknown media type	- Drive doesn't support this function or
 13448                                  ;				  the media is really unkown, any error
 13449                                  ;				  other than "media not present"
 13450                                  ; 
 13451                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13452                                  
 13453                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13454                                  SenseMediaType:				
 13455 00001306 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; DS:BX	points to request header.
 13456 0000130A C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 13457                                  		; 10/10/2022
 13458                                  		;mov	word [bx], 0	; Initialize the 2 packet bytes
 13459 0000130D 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13460 0000130F 8917                    		mov	[bx], dx ; 0
 13461                                  		;
 13462 00001311 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13463                                  					; Get int 13h drive number from	BDS
 13464                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13465                                  		;xor	dh, dh		; DX = physical	drive number
 13466 00001315 B420                    		mov	ah, 20h		; Get Media Type function
 13467                                  					; If no	carry media type in AL
 13468 00001317 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - QCACHE	- DISMOUNT
 13469 00001319 7216                    		jb	short MediaSenseEr ; error code	in AH
 13470 0000131B FE07                    		inc	byte [bx]	; Signal media type is default (bit 1)
 13471                                  DetermineMediaType:			
 13472 0000131D FEC8                    		dec	al
 13473 0000131F 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; Chk for 720K ie: (3-1) = 2
 13474 00001321 740A                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 13475 00001323 0404                    		add	al, 4
 13476 00001325 3C07                    		cmp	al, 7		; Chk for 1.44M ie: (4-1+4) = 7
 13477 00001327 7404                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 13478 00001329 3C09                    		cmp	al, 9		; Chk for 2.88M	ie: (6-1+4) = 9
 13479 0000132B 7510                    		jnz	short UnknownMediaType ; Just didn't recognize media type
 13480                                  GotMediaType:				
 13481 0000132D 884701                  		mov	[bx+1],	al	; Save the return value
 13482                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13483                                  		; cf = 0
 13484                                  		;clc			; Signal success
 13485 00001330 C3                      		retn
 13486                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13487                                  
 13488                                  MediaSenseEr:				
 13489 00001331 80FC32                  		cmp	ah, 32h		; See if not default media error
 13490 00001334 74E7                    		jz	short DetermineMediaType ; Not really an error
 13491 00001336 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; Now assume drive not ready
 13492 00001338 80FC31                  		cmp	ah, 31h		; See if media was present
 13493 0000133B 7402                    		jz	short SenseErrExit ; Return drive not ready
 13494                                  UnknownMediaType:			
 13495 0000133D B007                    		mov	al, 7		; Just don't know the media type
 13496                                  SenseErrExit:				
 13497 0000133F B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; Signal error return
 13498 00001341 F9                      		stc
 13499 00001342 C3                      		retn
 13500                                  
 13501                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13502                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13503                                  		;db    0
 13504                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13505                                  
 13506                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13507                                  
 13508                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13509                                  ; MSINT13.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 13510                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13511                                  ; 16/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 13512                                  
 13513                                  ;	int 2f function 13h allows the user to change the orig13 int_13 vector
 13514                                  ;	after booting. this allows testing and implementation of custom int_13
 13515                                  ;	handlers, without giving up ms-dos error recovery
 13516                                  ;	entry:	ds:dx	== addr. of new int_13 handler
 13517                                  ;		es:bx	== addr. of new int_13 vector used by warm boot (int19)
 13518                                  ;	exit:	orig13	== address of new int_13 handler
 13519                                  ;		ds:dx	== old orig13 value
 13520                                  ;		es:bx	== old old13  value
 13521                                  ;
 13522                                  ; int 2f handler for external block drivers to communicate with the internal
 13523                                  ; block driver in msdisk. the multiplex number chosen is 8. the handler
 13524                                  ; sets up the pointer to the request packet in [ptrsav] and then jumps to
 13525                                  ; dsk_entry, the entry point for all disk requests.
 13526                                  ;
 13527                                  ; on exit from this driver, we will return to the external driver
 13528                                  ; that issued this int 2f, and can then remove the flags from the stack.
 13529                                  ; this scheme allows us to have a small external device driver, and makes
 13530                                  ; the maintainance of the various drivers (driver and msbio) much easier,
 13531                                  ; since we only need to make changes in one place (most of the time).
 13532                                  ;
 13533                                  ;   ax=800h - check for installed handler - reserved
 13534                                  ;   ax=801h - install the bds into the linked list
 13535                                  ;   ax=802h - dos request
 13536                                  ;   ax=803h - return bds table starting pointer in ds:di
 13537                                  ;	   (ems device driver hooks int 13h to handle 16kb dma overrun
 13538                                  ;	    problem. bds table is going to be used to get head/sector
 13539                                  ;	    informations without calling generic ioctl get device parm call.)
 13540                                  
 13541                                  ;BIOSSEGMENT equ 70h
 13542                                  DOSBIOSSEG equ 0070h ; 17/10/2022	
 13543                                  
 13544                                  ;;BIOSCODE:1302h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
 13545                                  
 13546                                  i2f_handler:				; here is 02C7h:1302h =	0070h:3872h
 13547 00001343 80FC13                  		cmp	ah, 13h
 13548 00001346 7413                    		jz	short int2f_replace_int13
 13549 00001348 80FC08                  		cmp	ah, 8
 13550 0000134B 7431                    		jz	short mine
 13551                                  
 13552                                  ; Check for WIN386 startup and return the BIOS instance data
 13553                                  
 13554 0000134D 80FC16                  		cmp	ah, 16h		; MultWin386
 13555 00001350 746C                    		jz	short win386call
 13556 00001352 80FC4A                  		cmp	ah, 4Ah		; multMULT
 13557 00001355 7503                    		jnz	short i2f_handler_iret
 13558 00001357 E99700                  		jmp	handle_multmult
 13559                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13560                                  
 13561                                  i2f_handler_iret:			
 13562 0000135A CF                      		iret
 13563                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13564                                  
 13565                                  int2f_replace_int13:
 13566 0000135B 50                      		push	ax	; free up a register for caller's ds
 13567 0000135C 8CD8                    		mov	ax, ds	; then we can use ds: -> Bios_Data
 13568                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h] ; 15/10/2022	
 13569                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13570                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13571 0000135E 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
 13572                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13573                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13	; save old value of old13 and
 13574                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13+2	; orig13 so that we can
 13575                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13	; return them to caller
 13576                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13+2
 13577                                  		
 13578                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 13579                                  		;push	word [Orig13]
 13580 00001363 FF36[B600]              		push	word [Orig13+2]
 13581                                  		;push	word [Old13]
 13582 00001367 FF36[0801]              		push	word [Old13+2]
 13583                                  
 13584                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13, dx	; orig13 := addr. of new int_13
 13585                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13+2, ax
 13586                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13, bx	; old13 := addr. of new boot_13
 13587                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13+2, es
 13588                                  		
 13589                                  		;mov	[Orig13], dx
 13590                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13591 0000136B 8716[B400]              		xchg	dx, [Orig13]
 13592 0000136F A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
 13593                                  		;mov	[Old13], bx
 13594                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13595 00001372 871E[0601]              		xchg	bx, [Old13]
 13596 00001376 8C06[0801]              		mov	[Old13+2], es
 13597                                  
 13598 0000137A 07                      		pop	es			; es:bx := old old13 vector
 13599                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13600                                  		;pop	bx
 13601 0000137B 1F                      		pop	ds			; ds:dx := old orig13 vector
 13602                                  		;pop	dx ; 02/09/2023
 13603 0000137C 58                      		pop	ax
 13604                                  i2f_iret:
 13605 0000137D CF                      		iret
 13606                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13607                                  
 13608                                  mine:
 13609 0000137E 3CF8                    		cmp	al, 0F8h 		; iret on reserved functions
 13610 00001380 73FB                    		jnb	short i2f_iret
 13611 00001382 08C0                    		or	al, al			; a get installed state request?
 13612 00001384 7503                    		jnz	short disp_func
 13613 00001386 B0FF                    		mov	al, 0FFh
 13614                                  		;jmp	short i2f_iret
 13615                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13616 00001388 CF                      		iret
 13617                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13618                                  
 13619                                  disp_func:
 13620 00001389 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1			; request for installing bds?
 13621 0000138B 7418                    		jz	short do_subfun_01
 13622 0000138D 3C03                    		cmp	al, 3			; get bds vector?
 13623 0000138F 7423                    		jz	short do_get_bds_vector
 13624                                  
 13625                                  ; set up pointer to request packet
 13626                                  
 13627 00001391 1E                      		push	ds
 13628 00001392 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022	
 13629                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13630                                  					; = [0070h:25A0h] = [02C7h:0030h]
 13631                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13632                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:ptrsav, bx
 13633                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:ptrsav+2, es
 13634 00001397 891E[1200]              		mov	[ptrsav], bx
 13635 0000139B 8C06[1400]              		mov	[ptrsav+2], es
 13636 0000139F 1F                      		pop	ds
 13637                                  		;jmp	far ptr	i2f_dskentry
 13638                                  		; 07/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 13639                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:1708h
 13640 000013A0 EA[1907]7000            		jmp	DOSBIOSSEG:dsk_entry ; BIOSDATA:dsk_entry
 13641                                  		;; 17/10/2022
 13642                                  		;;jmp	far DOSBIOSSEG:dsk_entry		
 13643                                  		;jmp	DOSBIOSSEG:i2f_dskentry ; 70h:i2f_dskentry
 13644                                  					; NOTE: jump to a FAR function, not an
 13645                                  					;  IRET type function. Callers of
 13646                                  					;  this int2f subfunction will have
 13647                                  					;  to be careful to do a popf
 13648                                  
 13649                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13650                                  
 13651                                  do_subfun_01:
 13652 000013A5 06                      		push	es
 13653 000013A6 1E                      		push	ds
 13654 000013A7 1E                      		push	ds
 13655 000013A8 07                      		pop	es
 13656                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13657 000013A9 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]	
 13658                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13659                                  					; point	ds: -> Bios_Data
 13660 000013AE E8BC03                  		call	install_bds
 13661 000013B1 1F                      		pop	ds
 13662 000013B2 07                      		pop	es
 13663                                  		;jmp	short i2f_iret
 13664                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13665 000013B3 CF                      		iret
 13666                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13667                                  
 13668                                  do_get_bds_vector:
 13669                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13670 000013B4 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]			
 13671                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13672 000013B9 C53E[1901]              		lds	di, [start_bds]
 13673                                  		;lds	di, ds:start_bds
 13674                                  ;ii2f_iret:	; 10/12/2022
 13675                                  		;jmp	short i2f_iret
 13676                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13677 000013BD CF                      		iret
 13678                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13679                                  
 13680                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13681                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13682                                  
 13683                                  ; WIN386 startup stuff is done here. If starting up we set our WIN386 present
 13684                                  ; flag and return instance data. If exiting, we reset the WIN386 present flag
 13685                                  ; NOTE: We assume that the BIOS int 2fh is at the bottom of the chain.
 13686                                  
 13687                                  win386call:				
 13688 000013BE 1E                      		push	ds
 13689 000013BF 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13690                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13691                                  					; at 2C7h:30h =	70h:25A0h
 13692 000013C4 3C05                    		cmp	al, 5		; Win386_Init
 13693                                  					; is it	win386 initializing?
 13694 000013C6 7410                    		jz	short Win386Init
 13695 000013C8 3C06                    		cmp	al, 6		; Win386_Exit
 13696                                  					; is it	win386 exiting?
 13697 000013CA 7523                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not, continue int2f chain
 13698                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13699 000013CC F6C201                  		test	dl, 1
 13700                                  		;test	dx, 1		; is it	win386 or win286 dos extender?
 13701 000013CF 751E                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not win386, then continue
 13702                                  		;and	ds:IsWin386, 0	; indicate that	win386 is not present  
 13703 000013D1 8026[6F08]00            		and	byte [IsWin386], 0 
 13704 000013D6 EB17                    		jmp	short win_iret
 13705                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13706                                  
 13707                                  Win386Init:
 13708                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13709 000013D8 F6C201                  		test	dl, 1
 13710                                  		;test	dx, 1		; is it win386 or win286 dos extender?
 13711 000013DB 7512                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not win386, then continue
 13712                                  		;or	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Indicate WIN386 present
 13713 000013DD 800E[6F08]01            		or	byte [IsWin386], 1
 13714                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:SI_Next, bx	; Hook our structure into chain
 13715                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:SI_Next+2, es
 13716 000013E2 891E[3D08]              		mov	[SI_Next], bx
 13717 000013E6 8C06[3F08]              		mov	[SI_Next+2], es
 13718                                  		;mov	bx, offset Win386_SI ; point ES:BX to Win386_SI
 13719 000013EA BB[3B08]                		mov	bx, Win386_SI	; 19/10/2022
 13720 000013ED 1E                      		push	ds
 13721 000013EE 07                      		pop	es
 13722                                  win_iret:
 13723 000013EF 1F                      		pop	ds
 13724                                  ii2f_iret:	; 10/12/2022
 13725                                  		;jmp	short i2f_iret	; return back up the chain
 13726                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13727 000013F0 CF                      		iret
 13728                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13729                                  
 13730                                  handle_multmult:
 13731 000013F1 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1
 13732 000013F3 7514                    		jnz	short try_2
 13733 000013F5 1E                      		push	ds
 13734 000013F6 E84500                  		call	HMAPtr		; get offset of free HMA
 13735                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13736                                  		;xor	bx, bx
 13737                                  		;dec	bx
 13738 000013F9 BBFFFF                  		mov	bx, 0FFFFh
 13739 000013FC 8EC3                    		mov	es, bx		; seg of HMA
 13740 000013FE 89FB                    		mov	bx, di
 13741 00001400 F7D3                    		not	bx
 13742 00001402 09DB                    		or	bx, bx
 13743 00001404 7401                    		jz	short try_1
 13744 00001406 43                      		inc	bx
 13745                                  try_1:
 13746 00001407 1F                      		pop	ds
 13747                                  		;jmp	short ii2f_iret
 13748                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13749 00001408 CF                      		iret
 13750                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13751                                  
 13752                                  try_2:
 13753 00001409 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; multMULTALLOCHMA
 13754 0000140B 7530                    		jnz	short try_3
 13755 0000140D 1E                      		push	ds
 13756                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13757                                  		;xor	di, di
 13758                                  		;dec	di
 13759 0000140E BFFFFF                  		mov	di, 0FFFFh	; assume not enough space
 13760 00001411 8EC7                    		mov	es, di

 13762 00001416 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13763 00001419 7421                    		jz	short InsuffHMA

 13765 0000141D 39FB                    		cmp	bx, di
 13766 0000141F 7605                    		jbe	short try_4
 13767                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13768                                  		;sub	di, di
 13769                                  		;dec	di
 13770 00001421 BFFFFF                  		mov	di, 0FFFFh
 13771                                  		;jmp	short InsuffHMA
 13772                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13773 00001424 1F                      		pop	ds
 13774 00001425 CF                      		iret

 13781                                  		;and	bx, 0FFF0h

 13789                                  					; no more HMA if we have wrapped

 13802                                  
 13803                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13804                                  
 13805                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13806                                  
 13807                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13808                                  ;
 13809                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13810                                  ;
 13811                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13812                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13813                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13814                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13815                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13816                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13817                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13818                                  ;
 13819                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13820                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13821                                  ;
 13822                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13823                                  
 13824                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13825                                  HMAPtr:
 13826 0000143E 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13827                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13828 00001443 8B3E[9608]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13829                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13830 00001447 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13831 0000144A 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13832 0000144C 803E[9C08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13833                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13834 00001451 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13835 00001453 FF1E[9808]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13836                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13837 00001457 8B3E[9608]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13838                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13839                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13840 0000145B C3                      		retn
 13841                                  
 13842                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13843                                  
 13844                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13845                                  
 13846                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13847                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13848                                  
 13849                                  move_sector:
 13850                                  
 13851                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13852                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13853                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13854                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13855                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13856                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13857                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13858                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13859                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13860                                  ;
 13861                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13862                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13863                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13864                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13865                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13866                                  
 13867 0000145C FC                      		cld
 13868 0000145D 51                      		push	cx
 13869 0000145E B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13870 00001461 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13871 00001465 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13872 00001467 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13873 0000146B 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13874 0000146D F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13875 0000146F 59                      		pop	cx
 13876 00001470 C3                      		retn
 13877                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13878                                  
 13879                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13880 00001471 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13881 00001473 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13882 00001475 59                      		pop	cx
 13883 00001476 C3                      		retn
 13884                                  
 13885                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13886                                  
 13887                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13888                                  
 13889                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13890                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13891                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13892                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13893                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13894                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13895                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13896                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13897                                  ;
 13898                                  ; input conditions:
 13899                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13900                                  ;
 13901                                  ; output:
 13902                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13903                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13904                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13905                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13906                                  
 13907                                  check_wrap:	
 13908 00001477 50                      		push	ax
 13909 00001478 53                      		push	bx
 13910 00001479 06                      		push	es
 13911 0000147A 57                      		push	di
 13912 0000147B E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13913 0000147E 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13914                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13915 00001480 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13916                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13917 00001485 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13918 00001487 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13919 0000148B 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13920 0000148D 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13921 00001490 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13922 00001492 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13923 00001494 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13924                                  
 13925                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13926                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13927                                  
 13928 00001496 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13929 00001498 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13930                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13931 0000149A 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13932 0000149B 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13933                                  					; if on	boundary
 13934                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13935                                  not_on_bound:
 13936 0000149D 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13937 000014A0 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13938 000014A2 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13939 000014A4 40                      		inc	ax
 13940 000014A5 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13941 000014A7 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13942                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13943 000014AA 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13944 000014AE 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 13945                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13946                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13947 000014B0 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13948 000014B2 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13949 000014B3 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13950                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13951 000014B5 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13952                                  
 13953                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13954                                  
 13955 000014B7 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13956 000014B9 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13957 000014BB 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13958                                  
 13959                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 13960                                  
 13961 000014BD 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 13962 000014BF 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 13963 000014C1 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 13964                                  no_head_bound:				
 13965 000014C2 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 13966 000014C4 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 13967 000014C5 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 13968 000014C7 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 13969 000014C9 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 13970 000014CB 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 13971 000014CE B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 13972 000014D0 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 13973 000014D2 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 13974 000014D4 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 13975 000014D6 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 13976 000014D8 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 13977 000014DA 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 13978 000014DC 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 13979                                  no_wrap:				
 13980 000014DE F8                      		clc
 13981 000014DF 5F                      		pop	di
 13982 000014E0 07                      		pop	es
 13983 000014E1 5B                      		pop	bx
 13984 000014E2 58                      		pop	ax
 13985 000014E3 C3                      		retn
 13986                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13987                                  
 13988                                  no_wrap_head:				
 13989 000014E4 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 13990 000014E6 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 13991 000014E8 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 13992                                  
 13993                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13994                                  
 13995                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13996                                  
 13997                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 13998                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 13999                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 14000                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 14001                                  ;
 14002                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 14003                                  
 14004                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14005                                  find_bds:	
 14006 000014EA C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 14007                                  fbds_1:					
 14008 000014EE 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14009 000014F2 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 14010 000014F4 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 14011                                  					; go to next bds
 14012 000014F7 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14013 000014FA 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 14014 000014FC F9                      		stc
 14015                                  fdbs_2:					
 14016 000014FD C3                      		retn
 14017                                  
 14018                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14019                                  
 14020                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14021                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14022                                  doint:
 14023                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14024 000014FE 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14025                                  					; get physical drive number
 14026                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 14027                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 14028                                  		
 14029 00001501 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14030 00001503 08C0                    		or	al, al
 14031 00001505 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 14032                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14033 00001507 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14034                                  					; get request code
 14035                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 14036 0000150A FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14037                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 14038 0000150D 9D                      		popf
 14039                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 14040                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14041 0000150E 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14042                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 14043                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14044 00001513 9C                      		pushf
 14045                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14046 00001514 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14047                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 14048                                  dointdone:				
 14049 00001517 C3                      		retn
 14050                                  
 14051                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14052                                  
 14053                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14054                                  
 14055                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 14056                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 14057                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 14058                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 14059                                  ;
 14060                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 14061                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 14062                                  ;
 14063                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 14064                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 14065                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 14066                                  
 14067                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 14068                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 14069                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 14070                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 14071                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 14072                                  ;.olddx: resw
 14073                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 14074                                  ;.olddd: resd
 14075                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 14076                                  ;end struc
 14077                                  
 14078                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14079                                  
 14080                                  ;   entry conditions:
 14081                                  ;	ah = function
 14082                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 14083                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 14084                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 14085                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 14086                                  ;   output conditions:
 14087                                  ;	no dma violation.
 14088                                  
 14089                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 14090                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 14091                                  ;
 14092                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 14093                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 14094                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 14095                                  
 14096                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14097                                  
 14098                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14099                                  
 14100 00001518 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 14101                                  
 14102                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14103                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14104                                  ; 09/12/2022
 14105                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 14106                                  
 14107                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14108                                  
 14109                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 14110                                  
 14111                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 14112                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 14113                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 14114                                  
 14115                                  format_special_stuff:			
 14116 0000151C 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 14117 00001521 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 14118 00001523 53                      		push	bx
 14119 00001524 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 14120 00001527 E83D04                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 14121 0000152A 5B                      		pop	bx
 14122 0000152B EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 14123                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14124                                  
 14125                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14126                                  
 14127                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 14128                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 14129                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 14130                                  
 14131                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14132                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 14133 0000152D 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 14134 0000152F 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 14135 00001531 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 14136 00001532 51                      		push	cx
 14137 00001533 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 14138 00001535 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 14139 00001537 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 14140 00001539 8406[2905]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 14141 0000153D 59                      		pop	cx
 14142 0000153E 58                      		pop	ax
 14143 0000153F 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14144                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 14145 00001541 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 14146 00001542 06                      		push	es
 14147                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14148 00001543 2EC41E[1815]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 14149                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 14150                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 14151 00001548 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 14152 0000154A 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 14153 0000154D 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 14154                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 14155                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 14156 00001551 07                      		pop	es
 14157 00001552 5B                      		pop	bx
 14158 00001553 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14159                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14160                                  
 14161                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14162                                  
 14163                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 14164                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 14165                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 14166                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 14167                                  
 14168                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 14169 00001555 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 14170                                  					; read driver parm ?
 14171 0000155A 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 14172 0000155C 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 14173                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 14174 00001561 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14175                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 14176 00001563 50                      		push	ax
 14177 00001564 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 14178                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 14179                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14180 00001566 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14181                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 14182                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14183 0000156B 58                      		pop	ax
 14184 0000156C EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14185                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14186                                  
 14187                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14188                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14189                                  
 14190                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 14191                                  
 14192                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 14193                                  
 14194                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 14195                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 14196                                  
 14197                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14198 0000156E 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 14199                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 14200                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 14201 0000156F 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14202                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 14203                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 14204                                  
 14205                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 14206                                  
 14207 00001574 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 14208 00001577 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14209 0000157A 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 14210                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 14211                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 14212 0000157C 803E[2905]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 14213 00001581 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 14214                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 14215                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 14216                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 14217 00001583 9A[7207]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14218                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14219                                  		
 14220 00001588 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 14221

 14223                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 14224 0000158E 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 14225                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 14226                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so
