 20185                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20186                                  ;
 20187                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 20188                                  ;
 20189                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 20190                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 20191                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 20192                                  ;
 20193                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 20194                                  ;
 20195                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20196                                  
 20197                                  AllocHMA:
 20198                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 20199                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 20200                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 20201                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 20202                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 20203                                  
 20204                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 20205                                  ;
 20206                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 20207                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 20208                                  ;	push	ax
 20209                                  ;	popf
 20210                                  ;	pushf
 20211                                  ;	pop	ax
 20212                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 20213                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 20214                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 20215                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 20216                                  
 20217                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20218                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 20219                                  
 20220 00000A60 1E                      	push	ds
 20221                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 20222                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT
 20223                                  	; 21/10/2022
 20224 00000A61 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 20225 00000A64 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20226                                  
 20227 00000A66 E84A00                  	call	IsXMSLoaded
 20228 00000A69 7545                    	jnz	short grabhma_error
 20229                                  
 20230 00000A6B B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 20231 00000A6E CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; get the vector into es:bx
 20232                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 20233                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 20234                                  
 20235 00000A70 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 20236                                  	;mov	[0Eh], bx
 20237 00000A74 8C06[1000]              	mov	[xms+2],es
 20238                                  	;mov	[10h],es
 20239                                  
 20240 00000A78 B401                    	mov	ah,1		; request HMA
 20241 00000A7A BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh
 20242                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 20243 00000A7D FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 20244 00000A81 48                      	dec	ax
 20245 00000A82 7409                    	jz	short allocHMA_1 ; error if not able to allocate HMA
 20246                                  
 20247                                  ;------ Himem may be lying because it has allocated mem for int 15
 20248                                  
 20249 00000A84 B488                    	mov	ah,88h
 20250 00000A86 CD15                    	int	15h
 20251                                  		; Get Extended Memory Size
 20252                                  		; Return: CF clear on success
 20253                                  		; AX = size of memory above 1M in K
 20254 00000A88 83F840                  	cmp	ax,64		; less than 64 K of hma ?
 20255                                  	;jb	short grabhma_error
 20256                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20257 00000A8B 7224                    	jb	short grabhma_err ; cf=1
 20258                                  allocHMA_1:
 20259 00000A8D B405                    	mov	ah,5		; localenableA20
 20260                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 20261 00000A8F FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 20262 00000A93 48                      	dec	ax
 20263 00000A94 751A                    	jnz	short grabhma_error ; error if couldn't enable A20
 20264                                  
 20265 00000A96 E88501                  	call	IsVDiskInstalled
 20266 00000A99 7415                    	jz	short grabhma_error ; yes, we cant use HMA
 20267                                  
 20268 00000A9B B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 20269 00000A9E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20270 00000AA0 26C70610003412          	mov	word [es:10h],1234h ; see if we can really read/write there
 20271 00000AA7 26813E10003412          	cmp	word [es:10h],1234h
 20272                                  	;jne	short grabhma_error ; don't try to load there if XMS lied
 20273                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20274 00000AAE 7401                    	je	short allocHMA_ok	
 20275                                  
 20276                                  ; 11/12/2022
 20277                                  ;	; 11/12/2022
 20278                                  ;	; cf=0
 20279                                  ;	;clc
 20280                                  ;	pop	ds
 20281                                  ;	retn
 20282                                  
 20283                                  grabhma_error:
 20284 00000AB0 F9                      	stc
 20285                                  	; 11/12/022
 20286                                  grabhma_err:	; cf=1
 20287                                  allocHMA_ok:	; cf=0
 20288 00000AB1 1F                      	pop	ds
 20289 00000AB2 C3                      	retn
 20290

 20355                                  
 20356                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20357                                  ;
 20358                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 20359                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 20360                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 20361                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 20362                                  ;
 20363                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 20364                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 20365                                  ;
 20366                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20367                                  
 20368                                  StartVDHead:
 20369                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 20370                                  
 20371 00000AD8 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 20372 00000ADC 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 20373 00000ADE 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 20374 00000AE0 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 20375 00000AE2 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 20376                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 20377 00000AE3 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 20378                                  VDiskSig1:
 20379 00000AEA 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20380                                  
 20381                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 20382                                  
 20383 00000AEF 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 20384                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 20385 00000AF5 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 20386 00000B04 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 20387 00000B06 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 20388                                  VDInt19:
 20389 00000B07 EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 20390                                  OldVDInt19:
 20391 00000B08 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 20392                                  
 20393                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 20394                                  
 20395                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 20396 00000B0C 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 20397                                  VDiskSig2:
 20398 00000B0F 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20399                                  
 20400                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 20401                                  
 20402 00000B14 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 20403 00000B17 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 20404 00000B19 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 20405 00000B1A 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 20406 00000B1C 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 20407 00000B1D 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 20408 00000B1F 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 20409 00000B21 FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 20410 00000B22 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 20411 00000B24 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 20412 00000B26 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 20413 00000B28 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 20414 00000B2A 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 20415                                  
 20416                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 20417                                  
 20418                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20419                                  ;
 20420                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 20421                                  ;
 20422                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 20423                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 20424                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 20425                                  ;
 20426                                  ; Inputs : None
 20427                                  ;
 20428                                  ; Outputs : None
 20429                                  ;
 20430                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 20431                                  ;
 20432                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20433                                  
 20434                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20435                                  
 20436                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 20437 00000B2C 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20438 00000B2E 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 20439                                  
 20440                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 20441                                  
 20442                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20443 00000B30 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 20444                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 20445 00000B33 2EA3[080B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 20446 00000B37 A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 20447                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20448 00000B3A 2EA3[0A0B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20449                                  
 20450                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 20451                                  
 20452 00000B3E B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 20453                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 20454                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20455 00000B40 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 20456 00000B43 CD21                    	int	21h
 20457                                  
 20458                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 20459                                  
 20460 00000B45 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 20461 00000B46 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20462                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 20463 00000B48 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 20464                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 20465 00000B4F 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 20466 00000B56 40                      	inc	ax
 20467 00000B57 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 20468                                  
 20469                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 20470                                  
 20471 00000B59 FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 20472                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 20473 00000B5A C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 20474 00000B60 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 20475                                  
 20476                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 20477                                  
 20478                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 20479 00000B63 B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 20480 00000B66 BE[D80A]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 20481 00000B69 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 20482 00000B6B 0E                      	push	cs
 20483 00000B6C 1F                      	pop	ds
 20484 00000B6D FC                      	cld
 20485 00000B6E F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 20486 00000B70 FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 20487                                  
 20488                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 20489                                  
 20490                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20491 00000B71 57                      	push	di
 20492 00000B72 06                      	push	es
 20493                                  
 20494                                  	;mov	ax,0FFFFh
 20495                                  	;mov	es,ax
 20496                                  	; 03/09/2023

 20498                                  	; cx = 0FFFFh
 20499 00000B74 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 20500                                  
 20501 00000B76 BF1000                  	mov	di,10h
 20502                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDiskHMAHead-VDiskHMAHead)
 20503 00000B79 B92000                  	mov	cx,32
 20504 00000B7C BE[0C0B]                	mov	si,VDiskHMAHead
 20505 00000B7F F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; ds already set to cs
 20506                                  
 20507 00000B81 5F                      	pop	di
 20508 00000B82 07                      	pop	es
 20509                                  
 20510 00000B83 C3                      	retn

 20512                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20513                                  ; procedure : ClrVDISKHeader
 20514                                  ;
 20515                                  ;		Clears the first 32 bytes at 1MB boundary
 20516                                  ;		So that DOS/HIMEM is not confused about the VDISK header
 20517                                  ;		left by previous DOS=HIGH session
 20518                                  ;

 20522 00000000 ????                     .seg_lim:	resw	1		; seg limit 64K 
 20523 00000002 ????                     .lo_word:	resw	1		; 24 bit seg physical 
 20524 00000004 ??                       .hi_byte:	resb 	1		; address

 20551 00000BAC 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 20552                                  
 20553 00000BB4 00<rep 20h>             ClrdVDISKHead:	times 32 db 0		; db 32 dup (0)
 20554

 20556                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, MSDOS 6.0 SYSINIT1.ASM)
 20557                                  
 20558                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 20559                                  ; (SYSINIT:0CA6h)
 20560                                  
 20561                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 20562                                  
 20563                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 20564                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 20565                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 20566                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 20567                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 20568                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 20569                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 20570                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 20571                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 20572                                  ;								      ;I070
 20573                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 20574                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 20575                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 20576                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 20577                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 20578                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 20579                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 20580                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 20581                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 20582                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 20583                                  ;								      ;I070
 20584                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 20585                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 20586                                  
 20587                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20588                                  	; ds = cs
 20589                                  
 20590                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 20591                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:0CBFh)
 20592                                  
 20593 00000BD4 06                      	push	es
 20594 00000BD5 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 20595 00000BD7 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 20596 00000BD9 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 20597 00000BDB D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 20598 00000BDD B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20599 00000BDF D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20600 00000BE1 05[B40B]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 20601 00000BE4 80D200                  	adc	dl,0
 20602                                  
 20603                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 20604                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 20605                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax
 20606                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 20607                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+4],dl
 20608                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20609                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax

 20611                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 20612 00000BEA 8816[980B]              	mov	[src_desc+4],dl
 20613

 20615 00000BF1 0E                      	push	cs

 20618 00000BF6 B487                    	mov	ah,87h

 20620                                  			; CX = number of words to move 
 20621                                  			; ES:SI -> global descriptor table

 20623 00000BFA 07                      	pop	es

 20633                                  ;		the offset.

 20653 00000C0F 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h

 21636                                  
 21637                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 21638                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 21639                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 21640                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 21641                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 21642                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 21643                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 21644                                  ;
 21645                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 21646                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 21647                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 21648                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 21649                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 21650                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 21651                                  ;
 21652                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 21653                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 21654                                  ;
 21655                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 21656                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 21657                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12

 21877                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 21878                                  ;
 21879                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 21880                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 21881                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 21882                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 21883                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed

 21897                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 21898                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 21899                                  ; carridge return.

 21902                                  ;character after =.

 22045                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22046                                  
 22047                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 22048                                  ;
 22049                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 22050                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 22051                                  ;
 22052                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 22053                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 22054                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 22055                                  
 22056                                  ParaRound:
 22057 00001153 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 22058 00001156 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 22059 00001158 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22060 0000115A D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22061 0000115C D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22062 0000115E C3                      	retn
 22063                                  
 22064                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22065                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 22066                                  ;
 22067                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 22068                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 22069                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 22070                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 22071                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 22072                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 22073                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 22074                                  ;
 22075                                  ;in: after relocation,
 22076                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 22077                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 22078                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 22079                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 22080                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 22081                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 22082                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 22083                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 22084                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 22085                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 22086                                  ;
 22087                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 22088                                  
 22089                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22090                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22091                                  sysinit_base:				
 22092 0000115F 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 22093 00001164 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 22094 00001169 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 22095 0000116B 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 22096 00001170 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 22097 00001175 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 22098 00001176 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 22099 00001177 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 22100                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 22101                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.

 22135                                  sum_up:
 22136                                  
 22137                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 22138                                  ;out:  ax - result
 22139                                  ;
 22140                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 22141                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 22142                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 22143                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.

 22146

 22155 0000119D 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax

 22157                                  					; whole test better fail.
 22158 000011A4 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 22159 000011A6 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 22160                                  sum1:

 22162 000011AA 46                      	inc	si
 22163 000011AB 46                      	inc	si
 22164 000011AC E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 22165                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 22166                                  sum_sys_code:
 22167                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22168 000011AE BEAE11                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22169                                  			    ; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22170                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 22171                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!

 22173                                  	; 02/11/2022
 22174                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 22175                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 22176 000011B1 B9[804D]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 22177 000011B4 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 22178 000011B6 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 22179                                  sum2:

 22181 000011BB 46                      	inc	si

 22190

 22211                                  ; Set_Buffer
 22212                                  ;
 22213                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 22214                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.

 22219                                  ;

 22244

 22267                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0

 22284                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22285                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 22286                                  ;
 22287                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 22288                                  ;
 22289                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 22290                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA

 22295 0000123A 53                      	push	bx
 22296 0000123B 52                      	push	dx

 22299                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 22300 00001245 83C00F                  	add	ax,15

 22302                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 22303                                  	; 12/12/2022

 22305 0000124A 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22306 0000124C B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 22307                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 22308 0000124F CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 22309 00001251 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 22310 00001254 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 22311                                  	
 22312                                  	;mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 22313                                  	; 05/09/2023

 22315 00001256 47                      	inc	di ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 22316                                  	; zf=1
 22317                                  	
 22318                                  	;zf=1
 22319                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 22320                                  	;zf=1
 22321 00001257 2E8E06[6403]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 22322                                  got_hma:
 22323 0000125C 5A                      	pop	dx
 22324 0000125D 5B                      	pop	bx
 22325 0000125E C3                      	retn

 22355                                  ; ======================================================================
 22356                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 22357                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22358                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22359                                  
 22360                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22361                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 22362                                  ;
 22363                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 22364                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 22365                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 22366                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 22367                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 22368                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 22369                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 22370                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 22371                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 22372                                  ;
 22373                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 22374                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 22375                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 22376                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 22377                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 22378                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 22379                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 22380                                  ;	conditions:
 22381                                  ;
 22382                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 22383                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 22384                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 22385                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 22386                                  ;
 22387                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 22388                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 22389                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 22390                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 22391                                  ;
 22392                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 22393                                  ;
 22394                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 22395                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 22396                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 22397                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 22398                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 22399                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 22400                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 22401                                  ;	interrupt line.
 22402                                  ;
 22403                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 22404                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 22405                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 22406                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 22407                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 22408                                  ;
 22409                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 22410                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 22411                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 22412                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 22413                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 22414                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 22415                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 22416                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 22417                                  ;
 22418                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 22419                                  
 22420                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22421                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 22422                                  
 22423                                  	; 14/12/2022
 22424                                  stackinit:
 22425 00001287 50                      	push	ax
 22426 00001288 1E                      	push	ds
 22427 00001289 06                      	push	es
 22428 0000128A 53                      	push	bx
 22429 0000128B 51                      	push	cx
 22430 0000128C 52                      	push	dx
 22431 0000128D 57                      	push	di
 22432 0000128E 56                      	push	si
 22433 0000128F 55                      	push	bp
 22434                                  
 22435                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 22436                                  
 22437                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22438                                  	; ds = cs
 22439 00001290 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 22440 00001293 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 22441                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22442                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 22443                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 22444 00001295 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 22445                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 22446 00001299 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 22447 0000129C 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 22448                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22449 000012A0 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 22450                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22451                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22452                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 22453 000012A3 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 22454                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22455 000012A7 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 22456 000012A9 A1[9202]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 22457                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22458                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22459                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 22460 000012AC 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 22461                                  
 22462                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 22463                                  
 22464                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 22465                                  
 22466                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 22467                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22468                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 22469 000012B0 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 22470                                  
 22471                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 22472                                  
 22473 000012B5 B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 22474                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 22475                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22476                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 22477 000012B8 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22478 000012BA 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 22479 000012BC 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 22480 000012C0 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22481 000012C2 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 22482                                  
 22483                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 22484                                  
 22485 000012C5 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 22486 000012CA 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 22487 000012CE F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22488 000012D0 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 22489 000012D2 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22490 000012D4 06                      	push	es
 22491 000012D5 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 22492                                  
 22493                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 22494                                  
 22495 000012D6 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 22496 000012DA FC                      	cld
 22497 000012DB F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 22498                                  
 22499 000012DD 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 22500                                  
 22501                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 22502                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 22503                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 22504                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 22505                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry
 22506                                  
 22507                                  buildloop:
 22508                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22509                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free	; mov [es:bp+0],0
 22510                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22511                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp],free
 22512                                  	; 06/07/2023
 22513 000012E1 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al ; 0 ; free
 22514 000012E5 26884601                	mov	[es:bp+intlevel],al	; ax = 0
 22515                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1],al
 22516 000012E9 26894602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],ax
 22517                                  	;mov	[es:bp2],ax
 22518 000012ED 26894604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ax
 22519                                  	;mov	[es:bp+4],ax
 22520 000012F1 031E[0600]              	add	bx,[stacksize]
 22521 000012F5 26895E06                	mov	[es:bp+newsp],bx		; mov [es:bp+6],bx
 22522                                  	;mov	[es:bp+6],bx
 22523 000012F9 26892F                  	mov	[es:bx],bp
 22524 000012FC 83C508                  	add	bp,entrysize ; 8
 22525                                  
 22526 000012FF E2E0                    	loop	buildloop
 22527                                  
 22528 00001301 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize ; 8
 22529 00001304 892E[0E00]              	mov	[lastentry],bp
 22530 00001308 892E[1000]              	mov	[nextentry],bp
 22531                                  
 22532 0000130C 1E                      	push	ds
 22533                                  	;mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 22534                                  	; 05/09/2023
 22535 0000130D B4F0                    	mov	ah,0F0h ; ax = 0F000h
 22536 0000130F 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 22537 00001311 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?
 22538 00001316 1F                      	pop	ds
 22539 00001317 7504                    	jne	short skip_disablenmis
 22540                                  
 22541 00001319 B007                    	mov	al,07h			; disable convertible nmis

 23263                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23264                                  
 23265                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23266                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 23267                                  
 23268                                  new_init_loop:
 23269                                  
 23270                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 23271                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 23272                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 23273                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 23274                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 23275                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 23276                                  
 23277 00001479 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 23278 0000147C 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 23279 0000147E 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 23280 00001482 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 23281                                  
 23282 00001485 1E                      	push	ds
 23283                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 23284                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 23285                                  	; 21/10/2022
 23286 00001486 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 23287 00001489 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 23288 0000148B 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 23289 0000148E 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 23290 00001490 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 23291 00001494 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 23292 00001497 1F                      	pop	ds
 23293                                  
 23294 00001498 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 23295 0000149B 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 23296 0000149F C3                      	retn
 23297

 23542                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 23543                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 23544                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 23545                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 23546                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 23547                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="

 23549                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE

 23551                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23552

 23554                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 23555 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX

 23579                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 23580 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 23581 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 23582 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 23583                                  endstruc
 23584                                  
 23585                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23586                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 23587                                  ;
 23588                                  ;
 23589                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 23590                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 23591                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23592                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23593                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23594                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23595                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23596                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23597                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23598                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23599                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23600                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 23601                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 23602                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 23603                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 23604                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 23605                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 23606                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 23607                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 23608                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 23609                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 23610                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 23611                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 23612                                  ;	   :
 23613                                  ;
 23614                                  ;Note:
 23615                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 23616                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 23617                                  ;
 23618                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 23619                                  ;
 23620                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 23621                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 23622                                  ;
 23623                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 23624                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 23625                                  ;
 23626                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 23627                                  ;
 23628                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 23629                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 23630                                  ;
 23631                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23632                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 23633                                  ;
 23634                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 23635                                  ;
 23636                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23637                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 23638                                  ;
 23639                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23640                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23641                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23642                                  ;
 23643                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 23644                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 23645                                  ;
 23646                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 23647                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 23648                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 23649                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23650                                  
 23651                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 23652                                  
 23653                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 23654                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 23655                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 23656                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 23657                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 23658                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 23659                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 23660                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 23661                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 23662                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 23663                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 23664                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 23665                                  
 23666                                  ;**** Function flags
 23667                                  
 23668                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 23669                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 23670                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 23671                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 23672                                  
 23673                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 23674                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 23675 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 23676 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 23677 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 23678 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 23679 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 23680 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 23681                                  endstruc
 23682                                  
 23683                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23684                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 23685                                  ;
 23686                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 23687                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 23688                                  ;	     +-
 23689                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 23690                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 23691                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 23692                                  ;	     |	:
 23693                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23694                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 23695                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 23696                                  ;	     |	:
 23697                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23698                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 23699                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 23700                                  ;	     +-	:
 23701                                  ;
 23702                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 23703                                  ;
 23704                                  ;Note:
 23705                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 23706                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 23707                                  ;
 23708                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23709                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23710                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23711                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23712                                  
 23713                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 23714                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 23715                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 23716                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 23717                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 23718                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 23719                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 23720                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 23721                                  
 23722                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 23723 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 23724 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 23725 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 23726 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 23727 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 23728                                  endstruc
 23729                                  
 23730                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23731                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 23732                                  ;
 23733                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 23734                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 23735                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 23736                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 23737                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 23738                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 23739                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 23740                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 23741                                  ;
 23742                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 23743                                  ;
 23744                                  ;            +-
 23745                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 23746                                  ;	    | or
 23747                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 23748                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 23749                                  ;	    | or
 23750                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 23751                                  ;	    | or
 23752                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 23753                                  ;	    | or
 23754                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 23755                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 23756                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 23757                                  ;	    | or
 23758                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 23759                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 23760                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 23761                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 23762                                  ;	    +-
 23763                                  ;
 23764                                  ;
 23765                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 23766                                  ;      list.
 23767                                  ;
 23768                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 23769                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 23770                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 23771                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23772

 23778 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 23779                                  endstruc

 23809                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error

 23896                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23897                                  ; SysParse;
 23898                                  ;
 23899                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 23900                                  ;
 23901                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 23902                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 23903                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 23904                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 23905                                  ;
 23906                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 23907                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 23908                                  ;		 is in DS.
 23909                                  ;
 23910                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 23911                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 23912                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 23913                                  ;
 23914                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 23915                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 23916                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 23917                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 23918                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 23919                                  ;
 23920                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23921                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 23922                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 23923                                  ;
 23924                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 23925                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 23926                                  ;
 23927                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 23928                                  ;
 23929                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 23930                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 23931                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 23932                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 23933                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 23934                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 23935                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 23936                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 23937                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 23938                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 23939                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 23940                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 23941                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 23942                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 23943                                  ;	     (tm08)
 23944                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 23945                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 23946                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 23947                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 23948                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 23949                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 23950                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 23951                                  ;					  (tm12)
 23952                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 23953                                  ;					  (tm13)
 23954                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 23955                                  ;					  (tm14)
 23956                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 23957                                  ;					  (tm15)
 23958                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 23959                                  
 23960                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 23961                                  
 23962                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 23963                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 23964                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 23965                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 23966                                  
 23967                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 23968                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 23969                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 23970                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 23971                                  ;
 23972                                  
 23973                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 23974                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 23975                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 23976                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 23977                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 23978                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 23979                                  
 23980                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 23981                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 23982                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 23983                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 23984                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 23985                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 23986                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 23987                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 23988                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 23989                                  
 23990                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 23991                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 23992                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 23993                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 23994                                  ;	     segment.
 23995                                  
 23996                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 23997                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 23998                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 23999                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 24000                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 24001                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 24002                                  
 24003                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K
 24004                                  ;	     Removed the include to STRUC.INC.	Replaced the STRUC macro
 24005                                  ;	     invocations with their normally expanded code; made comments
 24006                                  ;	     out of the STRUC macro invocation statements to maintain readability.
 24007                                  
 24008                                  ;  9/24/87 : Ed K (;AN024;) PTM1222
 24009                                  ;	     When no CONTROL for a keyword found, tried to fill in RESULT
 24010                                  ;	     pointed to by non-existant CONTROL.
 24011                                  
 24012                                  ; 10/15/87 : Ed K (;AN025;) PTM1672
 24013                                  ;	     A quoted text string can be framed only by double quote.  Remove
 24014                                  ;	     support to frame quoted text string with single quote.
 24015                                  ;	     (apostrophe) _$P_SorD_Quote is removed from PSDATA.INC.
 24016                                  ;	     _$P_SQuote EQU also removed from PSDATA.INC.  Any references to
 24017                                  ;	     single quote in PROC prologues are left as is for history reasons.
 24018                                  
 24019                                  ;	     This fixes another bug, not mentioned in p1672, in that two
 24020                                  ;	     quote chars within a quoted string is supposed to be reported as
 24021                                  ;	     one quote character, but is reported as two quotes.  This changed
 24022                                  ;	     two instructions in PROC _$P_Quoted_Str.
 24023                                  
 24024                                  ;	     Also fixed are several JMP that caused a NOP, these changed to
 24025                                  ;	     have the SHORT operator to avoid the unneeded NOP.

 24367                                  ; _$P_Chk_Pos_Control
 24368                                  ;
 24369                                  ; Function: Parse CONTROL block for a positional
 24370                                  ;
 24371                                  ; Input:     ES:BX -> CONTROL block

 24373                                  ;
 24374                                  ; Output:    None
 24375                                  ;
 24376                                  ; Use:	 _$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_Match_Flags
 24377                                  ;

 24379                                  ;***********************************************************************
