 24593                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24594                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 24595                                  ;
 24596                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 24597                                  ;
 24598                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 24599                                  ;	    AL = type
 24600                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 24601                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 24602                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 24603                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 24604                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 24605                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 24606                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 24607                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24608                                  ;
 24609                                  ; Output:   None
 24610                                  ;
 24611                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 24612                                  ;
 24613                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 24614                                  ;***********************************************************************

 24626

 24630                                  					;AN000;   then set it to the result

 25010                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25011                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 25012                                  ;
 25013                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 25014                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 25015                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 25016                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 25017                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 25018                                  ;
 25019                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 25020                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 25021                                  ;
 25022                                  ; Output:    None
 25023                                  ;
 25024                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 25025                                  ;
 25026                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 25027                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25028                                  
 25029                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25030                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 25031                                  
 25032                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25033                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C46h)  	
 25034                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 25035 00001936 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25036 00001937 2E800E[D914]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 25037 0000193D 2E8026[D914]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 25038                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],~_$P_Neg ; 07/07/2023 
 25039 00001943 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 25040 00001946 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 25041 00001948 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 25042                                  
 25043 0000194A 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 25044 0000194C 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 25045                                  
 25046 0000194E 2E800E[D914]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 25047                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 25048 00001954 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 25049                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 25050 00001955 E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 25051 00001958 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25052 00001959 C3                      	retn
 25053                                  
 25054                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25055                                  
 25056                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25057                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C6Ah)
 25058                                  
 25059                                  	; 26/10/2022
 25060                                  _$P_Value:				;AN000;
 25061 0000195A 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25062 0000195B 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25063 0000195C 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;

 25065 0000195E 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			;AN000; cx = higher 16 bits

 25068                                  _$P_Value_Loop:				;AN000;

 25075                                  
 25076 0000196F 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			;AN000;
 25077 00001971 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			;AN000; save binary number
 25078                                  
 25079                                  ; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25080                                  ; Ref: Disassembled PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM SYSINIT code
 25081                                  ;				Erdogan Tan - July 2023 
 25082                                  %if 0
 25083                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 2*x
 25084                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 25085                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25086                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25087                                  
 25088                                  	mov	bx,dx			;AN000; save low(2*x)
 25089                                  	mov	ax,cx			;AN000; save high(2*x)
 25090                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 4*x
 25091                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 25092                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25093                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25094                                  
 25095                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 8*x
 25096                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 25097                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25098                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25099                                  
 25100                                  	add	dx,bx			;AN000; now have 10*x
 25101                                  	adc	cx,ax			;AN000; 32bit ADD
 25102                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25103                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25104                                  
 25105                                  	add	dx,bp			;AN000; Add the current one degree decimal
 25106                                  	adc	cx,0			;AN000; if carry, add 1 to high 16bit
 25107                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25108                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25109                                  
 25110                                  	inc	si			;AN000; update pointer
 25111                                  	jmp	short _$P_Value_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 25112                                  ;_$P_Value_Err0:
 25113                                  %endif
 25114                                  ;****
 25115                                  %if 1
 25116                                  ; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25117                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2130h)
 25118                                  
 25119 00001973 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 25120 00001975 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; save binary number
 25121 00001977 E81C00                  	call	_$P_Value_2x_OVF 	; multiply cx:dx by 2 and then check overflow
 25122 0000197A 89D3                    	mov	bx,dx			; ax:bx = 2*(cx:dx)
 25123 0000197C 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx
 25124 0000197E E81500                  	call	_$P_Value_2x_OVF 	; multiply cx:dx by 2 and then check overflow
 25125 00001981 E81200                  	call	_$P_Value_2x_OVF 	; multiply cx:dx by 2 and then check overflow
 25126 00001984 01DA                    	add	dx,bx			; 8*(cx:dx)+2*(cx:dx) = 10*(cx:dx)
 25127 00001986 11C1                    	adc	cx,ax
 25128 00001988 E80F00                  	call	_$P_Value_Chk_Add_OVF
 25129 0000198B 01EA                    	add	dx,bp			; Add the current one degree decimal
 25130                                  					; if carry, add 1 to high 16bit

 25140                                  _$P_Value_Chk_Add_OVF:
 25141 0000199A E89E00                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		; check overflow (for the last shift or add)

 25964                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25965                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 25966                                  ;
 25967                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 25968                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 25969                                  ;	    blanks.
 25970                                  ;
 25971                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25972                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 25973                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 25974                                  ;
 25975                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 25976                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 25977                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 25978                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25979                                  
 25980                                  	; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25981                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FAEh
 25982                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2451h) ; (Retro DOS v5.0)
 25983                                  
 25984                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 25985 00001C7C 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 25986 00001C7D 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25987 00001C7E 2EC606[D314]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 25988                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 25989                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 25990 00001C84 2E8026[D914]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 25991 00001C8A 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 25992 00001C8C 7423                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25993                                  
 25994 00001C8E 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 25995 00001C90 741F                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 25996                                  
 25997 00001C92 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 25998 00001C94 741E                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 25999                                  
 26000                                  ; Note: _$P_Chk_Delim00 part of code is nonsense here
 26001                                  ;        because _$P_Space = _$P_DBSP1 = 20h
 26002                                  ;        Erdogan Tan - 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26003                                  ;_$P_Chk_Delim00:
 26004                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:246Bh)
 26005                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FC8h)
 26006                                  %if 0
 26007                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26008                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 26009                                  	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 26010                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 26011                                  
 26012                                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 26013                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 26014                                  
 26015                                  	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 26016                                  	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 26017                                  	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 26018                                  	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26019                                  %endif
 26020                                  
 26021                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 26022 00001C96 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 26023                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 26024 00001C9B 7214                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 26025                                  
 26026                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 26027 00001C9D 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 26028                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 26029 00001C9F 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 26030                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 26031                                  	;or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 26032                                  	;jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 26033                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26034 00001CA3 E30B                    	jcxz	_$P_Chk_Delim_NZ
 26035                                  
 26036 00001CA5 BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 26037                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 26038 00001CA8 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 26039 00001CA9 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 26040 00001CAC 7406                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 26041                                  
 26042 00001CAE E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_Delim_Loop	;AN000; examine all extra delimiter
 26043                                  
 26044                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ:			;AN000;
 26045                                  	;cmp	al,_$P_Space		;AN000; reset ZF
 26046                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26047                                  	; cx=0 here
 26048 00001CB0 41                      	inc	cx ; cx=1, zf=0
 26049                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 26050                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;
 26051 00001CB1 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26052 00001CB2 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 26053 00001CB3 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 26054                                  
 26055                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0:			;AN000;
 26056 00001CB4 2EA2[D314]              	mov	[cs:_$P_Terminator],al ;AC034; keep terminated delimiter
 26057 00001CB8 2EF606[D914]01          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AN027;AC034;; if terminating a key=
 26058 00001CBE 7506                    	jnz	short _$P_No_Set_Extra 	;AN027; then do not set the EXTRA bit
 26059                                  
 26060 00001CC0 2E800E[D914]20          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra 
 26061                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 26062                                  _$P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;
 26063 00001CC6 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; set ZF
 26064 00001CC8 EBE7                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;

 26066                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26067                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 26068                                  ;
 26069                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 26070                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 26071                                  ;
 26072                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26073                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 26074                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 26075                                  ;
 26076                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 26077                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 26078                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 26079                                  
 26080                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 26081                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 26082                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 26083                                  ;
 26084                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 26085                                  
 26086                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 26087                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26088                                  
 26089                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 26090                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 26091                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 26092                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26093 00001CCA BD[E214]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 26094                                  
 26095                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 26096 00001CCD 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 26097 00001CCF 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 26098                                  
 26099                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 26100 00001CD1 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26101 00001CD3 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 26102                                  
 26103 00001CD5 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 26104                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26105                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26106 00001CD6 C3                      	retn
 26107                                  
 26108                                  ; 12/12/2022
 26109                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 26110                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 26111                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 26112                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 26113                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26114                                  
 26115                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 26116                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 26117 00001CD7 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26118 00001CD9 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 26119                                  
 26120 00001CDB 2E800E[D914]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020 ;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 26121                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 26122                                  
 26123                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26124                                  	; cf=0
 26125                                  	;retn
 26126                                  
 26127                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 26128                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26129                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 26130 00001CE1 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 26131                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 26132                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 26133 00001CE2 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 26135                                  ;**************************************************************************
 26136                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 26137                                  ;
 26138                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 26139                                  ;
 26140                                  ;  Input:
 26141                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 26142                                  ;
 26143                                  ;  Output:
 26144                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 26145                                  ;
 26146                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 26147                                  ;
 26148                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 26149                                  ;***************************************************************************
 26150                                  
 26151                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 26152 00001CE3 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 26153 00001CE4 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 26154 00001CE5 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26155                                  	;cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 26156                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 26157                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26158 00001CE6 2E8B36[D614]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]
 26159 00001CEB 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 26160 00001CED 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 26161 00001CEF 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 26162 00001CF0 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26163 00001CF1 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26164 00001CF2 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 26165 00001CF3 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 26166 00001CF4 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 26167 00001CF5 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 26168                                  	; si = 0 ; 08/07/2023
 26169                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 26170 00001CF6 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 26171 00001CF8 B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 26172 00001CFB CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 26173                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 26174 00001CFD 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26175 00001CFF 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26176 00001D01 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 26177 00001D02 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 26178 00001D03 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 26179 00001D04 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 26180 00001D05 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26181 00001D06 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26182 00001D07 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 26183 00001D08 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 26184                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 26185 00001D0A 2E8936[D414]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 26186 00001D0F 2E891E[D614]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 26187                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 26188                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 26189                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 26190                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26191 00001D14 2EC536[D414]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 26192                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 26193 00001D19 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 26194 00001D1C 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 26195 00001D1E 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 26196 00001D20 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 26197 00001D22 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 26198 00001D25 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 26199 00001D27 F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 26200 00001D28 EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 26201                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 26202 00001D2A 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 26203 00001D2B 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 26204                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 26205 00001D2C EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 26206                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 26207                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26208                                  	; cf=0
 26209                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 26210                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 26211 00001D2E 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26212 00001D2F 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 26213 00001D30 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 26214 00001D31 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 26775                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 26776                                  
 26777                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 26778                                  
 26779                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26780                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26781                                  
 26782                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 26783                                  ;
 26784                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 26785                                  ;
 26786                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26787                                  ;
 26788                                  ;   Modification log:
 26789                                  ;
 26790                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 26791                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 26792                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 26793                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 26794                                  ;
 26795                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26796                                  ;
 26797                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 26798                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 26799                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 26800                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 26801                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 26802                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 26803                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 26804                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 26805                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 26806                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 26807                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 26808                                  ;
 26809                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26810                                  
 26811                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 26812                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 26813                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 26814                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 26815                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 26816                                  
 26817                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 26818                                  
 26819                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 26820                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 26821                                  
 26822                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 26823                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 26824                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 26825                                  
 26826                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 26827                                  ;
 26828                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 26829                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 26830                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 26831                                  ;	           line.
 26832                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 26833                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 26834                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 26835                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 26836                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 26837                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 26838                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 26839                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 26840                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 26841                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 26842                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 26843                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 26844                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 26845                                  ;	           for details).
 26846                                  
 26847 00001F31 00                      fInHigh:  db	0
 26848 00001F32 00                      fUmbTiny: db	0
 26849 00001F33 0000                    SegLoad:  dw	0
 26850 00001F35 00                      UmbLoad:  db	0
 26851 00001F36 00<rep 10h>             UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 26852 00001F46 0000<rep 10h>           UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 26853 00001F66 00                      fm_umb:   db	0
 26854 00001F67 00                      fm_strat: db	0
 26855 00001F68 00                      fm_argc:  db	0	
 26856                                  
 26857                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 26858                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 26859                                  
 26860                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 26861                                  
 26862                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 26863                                  
 26864                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****

 26868                                  
 26869                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26870                                  ; (SYSINIT:212Bh)	
 26871                                  
 26872                                  		;public	DevEntry
 26873                                  
 26874 00001F69 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 26875 00001F6B 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 26876 00001F6D 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 26877 00001F6F 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 26878 00001F73 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 26879                                  ; 30/12/2022
 26880                                  ; 27/10/2022 
 26881 00001F77 00                      ConvLoad:	db	0	; Use conventional (dos 5 -style) InitDevLoad?
 26882                                  ;
 26883 00001F78 00                      DevUMB:		db	0	; byte indicating whether to load DDs in UMBs
 26884 00001F79 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)
 26885 00001F7B 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 26886 00001F7D 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free are in the current UMB (paras)
 26887                                  ;

 26893 00001F87 00                      DeviceHi:	db	0	; Flag indicating whther the current device
 26894                                  				;  is being loaded into UMB
 26895 00001F88 0000                    DevSizeOption:	dw	0	; SIZE= option
 26896                                  ;
 26897 00001F8A 00                      Int12Lied:	db	0	; did we trap int 12 ?
 26898 00001F8B 0000                    OldInt12Mem:	dw	0	; value in 40:13h (int 12 ram)
 26899 00001F8D 50524F544D414E24        ThreeComName:	db	'PROTMAN$'	; 3Com Device name

 26903 00001F98 00000000                DevCmdLine:	dd	0	; Current Command line
 26904 00001F9C 00                      DevSavedDelim:	db	0	; The delimiter which was replaced with null
 26905                                  				; to use the file name in the command line
 26906                                  ;

 26936

 26941 00001FA8 8816[4946]              	mov	[def_swchr],dl ; 31/03/2019 
 26942                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 26943                                  
 26944 00001FAC BA[6045]                	mov	dx,config ;'\CONFIG.SYS' ;now pointing to file description
 26945 00001FAF B8003D                  	mov	ax,3D00h
 26946                                  	;mov	ax,OPEN<<8		;open file "config.sys"
 26947 00001FB2 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 26948 00001FB3 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 26949 00001FB5 7309                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay
 26950                                  
 26951                                  ; 31/12/2022
 26952                                  ; 27/10/2022

 26967                                  					; 08/09/2023 - Erdogan Tan - Note:
 26968 00001FCE 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; dx already must be 0 here ; 08/09/2023
 26969                                  					; I am not removing 'xor dx,dx' here
 26970                                  					; for MSDOS compatibility.

 26972                                  					; (Error will be same if CONGIG.SYS file
 26973                                  					;  size > 64KB)

 26977                                  
 26978                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2

 26980                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26981                                  	;mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 26982                                  
 26983 00001FD9 A1[5603]                	mov	ax,[count]
 26984 00001FDC A3[D002]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 26985 00001FDF E871F1                  	call	ParaRound
 26986 00001FE2 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 26987                                  
 26988                                  ; 31/12/2022
 26989                                  ; 27/10/2022
 26990                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26991                                  ;
 26992                                  ;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 26993                                  ;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 26994                                  ;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 26995                                  ;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 26996                                  ;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 26997                                  ;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 26998                                  ;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 26999                                  ;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 27000                                  ;
 27001 00001FE4 4A                      	dec	dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 27002 00001FE5 8916[BE14]              	mov	[config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 27003 00001FE9 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 27004                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG

 27006 00001FEB 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header
 27007                                  	
 27008                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27009 00001FEE 8916[A502]              	mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 27010 00001FF2 8916[A302]              	mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 27011                                  	
 27012                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27013                                  	;mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 27014                                  	;call    TempCDS 
 27015                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27016                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27017                                  	; ds <> cs 
 27018                                  	;mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]
 27019                                  
 27020                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27021                                  	; ds = cs
 27022 00001FF6 8B0E[5603]              	mov	cx,[count]
 27023                                  	
 27024 00001FFA 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 27025 00001FFC 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 27026                                  
 27027 00001FFE 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 27028                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27029                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:count]
 27030 00002000 B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 27031                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh
 27032 00002002 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 27033 00002003 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 27034 00002005 9C                      	pushf
 27035                                  
 27036                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 27037                                  
 27038 00002006 50                      	push	ax
 27039 00002007 57                      	push	di
 27040 00002008 51                      	push	cx
 27041 00002009 B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 27042 0000200B 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 27043 0000200D E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 27044 0000200F F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 27045 00002011 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 27046                                  
 27047                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 27048                                  
 27049 00002013 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 27050                                  
 27051                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 27052                                  
 27053                                  puteol:
 27054 00002014 B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 27055 00002016 AA                      	stosb
 27056 00002017 B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 27057 00002019 AA                      	stosb
 27058 0000201A 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 27059                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27060                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 27061                                  
 27062                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 27063                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27064 0000201C 0E                      	push	cs
 27065 0000201D 1F                      	pop	ds
 27066                                  
 27067 0000201E 893E[5603]              	mov	[count],di		; new count
 27068                                  
 27069 00002022 59                      	pop	cx
 27070 00002023 5F                      	pop	di
 27071 00002024 58                      	pop	ax
 27072                                  
 27073                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27074                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27075                                  	;push	cs
 27076                                  	;pop	ds
 27077                                  
 27078 00002025 50                      	push	ax
 27079                                  	;mov	ah,CLOSE
 27080 00002026 B43E                    	mov	ah,3Eh
 27081 00002028 CD21                    	int	21h
 27082 0000202A 58                      	pop	ax
 27083 0000202B 9D                      	popf
 27084 0000202C 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;if not we've got a problem
 27085 0000202E 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 27086 00002030 742D                    	jz	short getcom		;couldn't read the file
 27087                                  conferr:
 27088 00002032 BA[6045]                	mov	dx,config		;want to print config error
 27089 00002035 E87E24                  	call	badfil
 27090                                  ;endconv:	; 01/01/2023
 27091 00002038 C3                      	retn
 27092                                  
 27093                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27094                                  ;
 27095                                  ; entry : multi_pass
 27096                                  ;
 27097                                  ;             called to execute device=,install= commands
 27098                                  ;

 27101                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27102                                  multi_pass:
 27103 00002039 0E                      	push	cs
 27104 0000203A 1F                      	pop	ds
 27105                                  
 27106 0000203B 803E[CD02]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10
 27107                                  ;jae_endconv:
 27108 00002040 731C                    	jae	short endconv 		; do nothing. just return.
 27109                                  
 27110                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27111 00002042 FF36[A302]              	push	word [CONFBOT]
 27112                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27113                                  	;push	word [top_of_cdss]
 27114 00002046 07                      	pop	es			; es -> confbot
 27115                                  
 27116 00002047 8B36[5803]              	mov	si,[org_count]
 27117 0000204B 8936[5603]              	mov	[count],si		; set count
 27118 0000204F 31F6                    	xor	si,si ; 0
 27119 00002051 8936[5A03]                      mov     [chrptr],si		; reset chrptr
 27120 00002055 8936[AF02]                      mov     [linecount],si		; reset linecount
 27121                                  
 27122 00002059 E8E121                  	call	getchr
 27123 0000205C EB07                    	jmp	short conflp
 27124                                  
 27125                                  	; 01/01/2023
 27126                                  endconv:
 27127 0000205E C3                      	retn	
 27128                                  
 27129                                  getcom:
 27130                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27131                                  	; ds = cs
 27132 0000205F E81816                          call    organize                ; organize the file
 27133 00002062 E8D821                  	call	getchr
 27134                                  conflp: 
 27135 00002065 72F7                    	jc	short endconv
 27136                                  
 27137 00002067 FF06[AF02]                      inc     word [linecount]	; increase linecount
 27138                                  
 27139                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27140 0000206B 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah ; 0
 27141                                  	;mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 27142                                  	;mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 27143 0000206D 8826[C214]              	mov	[multdeviceflag],ah ; 0
 27144 00002071 8826[C514]              	mov	[setdevmarkflag],ah ; 0
 27145                                  
 27146 00002075 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 27147 00002077 7448                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 27148                                  
 27149                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27150                                  ; (SYSINIT:23CCh)
 27151                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27152                                  ;%if 0
 27153                                  
 27154                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27155                                  
 27156                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 27157                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 27158                                  
 27159 00002079 A2[C014]                        mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 27160                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 27161 0000207C 247F                    	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 27162                                  
 27163                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27164 0000207E 3826[C114]              	cmp	[config_multi],ah ; 0
 27165                                  	;cmp	byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 27166 00002082 7427                            je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 27167                                  
 27168 00002084 50                              push    ax                      ;
 27169 00002085 E8B521                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 27170 00002088 88C4                            mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 27171 0000208A E8B021                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 27172 0000208D 86C4                            xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 27173 0000208F A3[AF02]                        mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 27174 00002092 58                              pop     ax
 27175                                  ;
 27176                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 27177                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 27178                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 27179                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 27180                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 27181                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 27182                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 27183                                  ;   spot.
 27184                                  ;
 27185                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 27186                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 27187                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 27188                                  ;   retrieved.
 27189                                  ;
 27190 00002093 803E[CD02]02                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 27191 00002098 7211                            jb	short not_final		; no
 27192                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 27193 0000209A F606[CE02]01            	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 27194 0000209F 7407                            jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 27195 000020A1 803E[CD02]03                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 27196 000020A6 7203                            jb	short not_final		; no
 27197                                  final:                                  ;
 27198 000020A8 268804                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 27199                                  not_final:                              ;
 27200                                  ;endif
 27201                                  
 27202                                  ; 31/12/2022
 27203                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27204                                  
 27205 000020AB 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 27206 000020AD E88D21                  	call	getchr
 27207 000020B0 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 27208                                  
 27209 000020B2 803E[CD02]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 27210                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 27211                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27212 000020B7 73A5                    	jnb	short endconv	
 27213 000020B9 E95608                  	jmp	badop
 27214                                  	
 27215                                  coff:	
 27216                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27217                                  	; ds = cs
 27218                                  	;push	cs
 27219                                  	;pop	ds
 27220 000020BC E87521                  	call	newline
 27221 000020BF EBA4                    	jmp	short conflp	; 13/05/2019
 27222                                  
 27223                                  blank_line:
 27224 000020C1 E87921                  	call	getchr
 27225 000020C4 EB9F                    	jmp	short conflp
 27226                                  
 27227                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27228                                  ; 11/12/2022
 27229                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 27230                                  ;coff_p:
 27231                                  	;push	cs
 27232                                  	;pop	ds
 27233                                  
 27234                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 27235                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 27236                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 27237                                  ;install= command.
 27238                                  
 27239                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27240                                  ;install command
 27241                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27242                                  
 27243                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27244                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 27245                                  tryi:
 27246 000020C6 803E[CD02]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI
 27247 000020CB 7503                    	jne	short not_init_pass
 27248 000020CD E97F01                  	jmp	multi_try_doshi
 27249                                  not_init_pass:
 27250 000020D0 803E[CD02]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; the second pass was for ifs=
 27251                                          ; 11/12/2022
 27252                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2	; now it is NOPs
 27253 000020D5 74E5                    	je	short coff
 27254                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27255                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 27256                                  					; This pass can be made use of if
 27257                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 27258                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 27259                                  					; and before install= commands
 27260                                  					; are processed
 27261                                  
 27262 000020D7 803E[CD02]03            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; the third pass for install= ?
 27263 000020DC 741D                    	je	short multi_try_i
 27264 000020DE 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'
 27265                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27266                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2
 27267 000020E1 74D9                    	je	short coff
 27268                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27269                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 27270                                  
 27271                                  ;       make note of any INSTALL= or INSTALLHIGH= commands we find,
 27272                                  ;       but don't process them now.

 27390                                  ;									      *
 27391                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 27392                                  ;									      *
 27393                                  ; input :								      *
 27394                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 27395                                  ; output:								      *
 27396                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 27397                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *

 27411                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 27412                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *

 27415                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 27416                                  ;	};								      *

 28183                                  skip_pass_limit:
 28184                                  ;	Note: sysi_numio (in DOS DATA) currently reflects the REAL
 28185                                  ;	number of installed devices (including DblSpace drives) where
 28186                                  ;	"drivenumber" is the number that the next block device will
 28187                                  ;	be assigned to. Because some naughty device drivers (like
 28188                                  ;	interlnk) look at the internal DOS variable instead of the
 28189                                  ;	value we pass it, we'll temporarily stick our value into
 28190                                  ;	DOS DATA while we're initializing the device drivers.
 28191                                  ;
 28192                                  ;	Note that this will make it impossible for this device
 28193                                  ;	driver to access the DblSpace drive letters, whether
 28194                                  ;	they are swapped-hosts or unswapped compressed drives,
 28195                                  ;	during its initialization phase.
 28196

 28205                                  	; 31/12/2022

 28207                                  	; 08/09/2023
 28208                                  	;lds	bx,[DOSINFO]		; ds:bx -> sys_var
 28209                                  
 28210                                  	;mov	al,[cs:drivenumber]	; temporarily use this next drv value
 28211                                  	;mov	[cs:devdrivenum],al	; pass drive number in packet to driver
 28212                                  	;mov	ah,al

 29122                                  trypbad:
 29123 000026F0 E91F02                  	jmp	badop
 29124                                  
 29125                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29126                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 29127                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 29128                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 29129                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 29130                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 29131                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 29132                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 29133                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29134                                  
 29135                                  ;**************************************************************************
 29136                                  ;									  *
 29137                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 29138                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 29139                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 29140                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 29141                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 29142                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 29143                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 29144                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 29145                                  ; input :								  *
 29146                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 29147                                  ; output:								  *
 29148                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 29149                                  ;									  *
 29150                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 29151                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 29152                                  ; logic:								  *
 29153                                  ; {									  *
 29154                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 29155                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 29156                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 29157                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 29158                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *

 29917                                  
 29918                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29919                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 29920                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 29921                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 29922                                  ;
 29923                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 29924                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 29925                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 29926                                  ;	*** after each call.
 29927                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 29928                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 29929                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 29930                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 29931                                  ;	 procedure.
 29932                                  ;	ax - exit code
 29933                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 29934                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 29935                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 29936                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer
 29937                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 30280                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30281                                  ;
 30282                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 30283                                  ;
 30284                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 30285                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 30286                                  ;
 30287                                  ;	Output : none
 30288                                  ;
 30289                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 30290                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 30291                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 30292                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 30293                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 30294                                  ;
 30295                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30296                                  
 30297                                  LieInt12Mem:
 30298                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30299                                  	; ds = cs
 30300 00002998 A1[A502]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]
 30301                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; lie INT 12 as alloclim
 30302                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 30303 0000299B E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 30304 0000299E 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 30305                                  	; 13/05/2019
 30306                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 30307                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 30308                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 30309                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30310                                  	; ds = cs
 30311 000029A0 803E[871F]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 30312 000029A5 74F0                    	je	short limx
 30313 000029A7 A1[6D1F]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 30314                                  lim_set:
 30315                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 30316                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30317                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 30318                                  ;limx:
 30319                                  	;retn
 30320                                  	
 30321                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 30322                                  
 30323                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30324                                  ;
 30325                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 30326                                  ;
 30327                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 30328                                  ;	Output : none
 30329                                  ;
 30330                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 30331                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 30332                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 30333                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 30334                                  ;
 30335                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30336                                  
 30337                                  	; 01/11/2022
 30338                                  SetInt12Mem:
 30339 000029AA 1E                      	push	ds
 30340 000029AB BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 30341 000029AE 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 30342 000029B0 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 30343 000029B4 2E891E[8B1F]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 30344 000029B9 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 30345 000029BB D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 30346 000029BD A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 30347 000029C0 2EC606[8A1F]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 30348 000029C6 1F                      	pop	ds
 30349                                  ;limx:
 30350 000029C7 C3                      	retn
 30351                                  
 30352                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30353                                  ;
 30354                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 30355                                  ;
 30356                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 30357                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 30358                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 30359                                  ;
 30360                                  ;	Output : none
 30361                                  ;
 30362                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 30363                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 30364                                  ;
 30365                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30366                                  
 30367                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 30368                                  	; 11/12/2022
 30369                                  	; ds = cs
 30370 000029C8 803E[8A1F]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 30371                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 30372                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 30373                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 30374 000029CD 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 30375                                  	; 18/12/2022
 30376 000029CF B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 30377 000029D2 8826[8A1F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 30378                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 30379                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 30380 000029D6 1E                      	push	ds
 30381                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 30382 000029D7 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 30383 000029D9 2EA1[8B1F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 30384 000029DD A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 30385 000029E0 1F                      	pop	ds
 30386                                  timx:
 30387 000029E1 C3                      	retn
