 30440                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30441                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 30442                                  
 30443                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 30444                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 30445                                  
 30446                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30447                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 30448                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30449                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30450                                  
 30451                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30452                                  ;
 30453                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 30454                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 30455                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 30456                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 30457                                  ;
 30458                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 30459                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 30460                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 30461                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 30462                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 30463                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 30464                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 30465                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 30466                                  ; available during the load.
 30467                                  ;
 30468                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 30469                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 30470                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 30471                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 30472                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 30473                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 30474                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 30475                                  ;
 30476                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 30477                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 30478                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 30479                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 30480                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 30481                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 30482                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 30483                                  ;
 30484                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30485                                  
 30486                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 30487                                  
 30488                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 30489                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 30490                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 30491                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 30492                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 30493                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 30494                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 30495                                  
 30496                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 30497                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 30498                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 30499                                  
 30500                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30501                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 30502                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30503                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 30504                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 30505                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 30506                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30507                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30508                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 30509                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 30510                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30511                                  
 30512                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30513                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 30514                                  
 30515                                  InitVar:
 30516                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30517                                  	; ds = cs
 30518                                  
 30519                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 30520                                  	; 03/01/2023
 30521                                  	;push	ax
 30522                                  	;push	cx
 30523                                  	;push	di
 30524 00002A0C 06                      	push	es
 30525                                  
 30526                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 30527 00002A0D 0E                      	push	cs
 30528 00002A0E 07                      	pop	es
 30529                                  
 30530 00002A0F 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 30531                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 30532                                  	;mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 30533                                  	;mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 30534                                  	;mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30535                                  	;				;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 30536                                  	;mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 30537                                  
 30538                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30539                                  	; ds = cs
 30540 00002A11 A2[321F]                	mov	[fUmbTiny],al		;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 30541 00002A14 A2[311F]                	mov	[fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 30542 00002A17 A3[331F]                	mov	[SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 30543 00002A1A C606[351F]FF            	mov	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 30544                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 30545 00002A1F A2[681F]                	mov	[fm_argc], al		;Start with zero args having been read
 30546                                  
 30547 00002A22 FC                      	cld
 30548                                  
 30549 00002A23 B91000                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 30550 00002A26 BF[361F]                	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 30551 00002A29 F3AA                    	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 30552                                  
 30553                                  	;mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 30554                                  	; 01/01/2033
 30555 00002A2B B110                    	mov	cl,MAXUMB ; 16
 30556 00002A2D BF[461F]                	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 30557 00002A30 F3AB                    	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 30558                                  
 30559                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 30560                                  
 30561                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 30562 00002A32 07                      	pop	es
 30563                                  	; 03/01/2023
 30564                                  	;pop	di
 30565                                  	;pop	cx
 30566                                  	;pop	ax	 	
 30567                                  
 30568 00002A33 C3                      	retn
 30569                                  
 30570                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30571                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 30572                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30573                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 30574                                  ; EXIT    : None
 30575                                  ; ERROR   : None
 30576                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 30577                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30578                                  
 30579                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30580                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 30581                                  FixMem:
 30582                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30583                                  	;push	ax
 30584                                  	;push	bx
 30585                                  	;push	cx
 30586                                  	;push	dx
 30587 00002A34 06                      	push	es
 30588                                  
 30589 00002A35 E84900                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 30590                                  
 30591 00002A38 E80002                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 30592 00002A3B 723F                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 30593                                  
 30594 00002A3D 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 30595                                  
 30596                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 30597                                  
 30598 00002A3F 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 30599 00002A41 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 30600 00002A43 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 30601                                  
 30602                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30603                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 30604                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 30605                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30606                                  
 30607 00002A44 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 30608 00002A48 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 30609 00002A4D 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 30610 00002A4F 7516                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 30611                                  
 30612                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 30613                                  
 30614 00002A51 268B1E0300              fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 30615 00002A56 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 30616 00002A58 26A20000                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 30617                                  
 30618 00002A5C 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 30619                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 30620                                  	; 11/07/2023
 30621 00002A61 43                      	inc	bx
 30622 00002A62 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 30623                                  
 30624                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 30625                                  
 30626 00002A67 8CC1                    fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 30627 00002A69 268B160100              	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 30628                                  
 30629 00002A6E 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 30630 00002A70 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 30631 00002A75 43                      	inc	bx
 30632 00002A76 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 30633                                  
 30634                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 30635 00002A78 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 30636 00002A7A 75C8                    	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 30637                                  fmX:	
 30638 00002A7C E81300                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 30639                                  
 30640 00002A7F 07                      	pop	es
 30641                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30642                                  	;pop	dx
 30643                                  	;pop	cx
 30644                                  	;pop	bx
 30645                                  	;pop	ax
 30646                                  
 30647 00002A80 C3                      	retn
 30648                                  
 30649                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30650                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 30651                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30652                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 30653                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 30654                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30655                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 30656                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30657                                  
 30658                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30659                                  fm_link:
 30660 00002A81 B80258                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 30661 00002A84 CD21                    	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 30662                                  
 30663                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 30664                                  	;
 30665                                  	;push	es
 30666                                  	;push	cs
 30667                                  	;pop	es
 30668                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 30669                                  	;pop	es
 30670                                  	
 30671                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30672                                  	; ds = cs
 30673                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_umb],al

 30713                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30714                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 30715                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 30716                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30717                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 30718                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 30719                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 30720                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30721                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30722                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 30723                                  ;
 30724                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 30725                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 30726                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30727                                  ;
 30728                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 30729                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 30730                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 30731                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 30732                                  ;
 30733                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 30734                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 30735                                  ;
 30736                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30737                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 30738                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 30739                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 30740                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 30741                                  ;     lh
 30742                                  ;     /l
 30743                                  ;     1
 30744                                  ;     1000
 30745                                  ;     2
 30746                                  ;     print
 30747                                  ;     /d
 30748                                  ;     :lpt2
 30749                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 30750                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 30751                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 30752                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 30753                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 30754                                  ; for:
 30755                                  ;    Each /L
 30756                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 30757                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 30758                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 30759                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 30760                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 30761                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30762                                  
 30763                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30764                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 30765                                  
 30766                                  ParseVar:
 30767                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 30768                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30769                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 30770 00002A9E 1E                      	push	ds
 30771 00002A9F 06                      	push	es
 30772                                  
 30773 00002AA0 06                      	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 30774 00002AA1 1F                      	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 30775 00002AA2 FC                      	cld
 30776                                  
 30777                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30778                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 30779                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 30780                                  
 30781 00002AA3 AC                      pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 30782 00002AA4 E8A200                  	call	isWhite
 30783 00002AA7 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 30784                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30785 00002AA9 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH
 30786 00002AAB 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 30787                                  
 30788 00002AAD 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 30789 00002AAE F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 30790 00002AAF EB2B                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 30791                                  
 30792 00002AB1 AC                      pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 30793                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 30794 00002AB2 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 30795                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 30796 00002AB4 3C53                    	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 30797 00002AB6 750D                    	jne	short pv30
 30798                                  
 30799                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 30800 00002AB8 2EFE06[681F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 30801                                  
 30802                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 30803                                  	;
 30804                                  	;push	es
 30805                                  	;push	cs
 30806                                  	;pop	es
 30807                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 30808                                  	;pop	es
 30809                                  
 30810 00002ABD 2EC606[321F]01          	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 30811                                  
 30812 00002AC3 EBDE                    	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 30813                                  
 30814                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 30815 00002AC5 3C4C                    	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 30816 00002AC7 750D                    	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 30817                                  
 30818                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 30819 00002AC9 2EFE06[681F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 30820                                  
 30821 00002ACE E80E00                  	call	parseL
 30822 00002AD1 73D0                    	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 30823                                  
 30824 00002AD3 4E                      	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 30825 00002AD4 EB03                    	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 30826                                  
 30827                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 30828 00002AD6 B80300                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30829 00002AD9 4E                      pvErr:	dec	si
 30830 00002ADA 4E                      	dec	si
 30831 00002ADB F9                      	stc
 30832                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 30833 00002ADC 07                      	pop	es
 30834 00002ADD 1F                      	pop	ds
 30835                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30836                                  	;pop	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 30837 00002ADE C3                      	retn
 30838                                  
 30839                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30840                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 30841                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30842                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 30843                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 30844                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 30845                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 30846                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30847                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 30848                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 30849                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 30850                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 30851                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30852                                  
 30853                                  parseL:
 30854 00002ADF AC                      	lodsb
 30855 00002AE0 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 30856 00002AE2 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 30857                                  
 30858                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30859                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 30860                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30861                                  
 30862 00002AE4 E8DB00                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 30863 00002AE7 724F                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 30864 00002AE9 E89D01                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 30865                                  
 30866 00002AEC 88C1                    	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 30867 00002AEE E87600                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 30868 00002AF1 7245                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 30869                                  
 30870                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 30871 00002AF3 2EFE06[681F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30872                                  
 30873 00002AF8 AC                      	lodsb
 30874 00002AF9 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 30875 00002AFB 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 30876                                  
 30877 00002AFD E84900                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 30878 00002B00 743B                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 30879                                  
 30880 00002B02 E83900                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 30881 00002B05 7435                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 30882                                  
 30883                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30884 00002B07 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 30885 00002B09 7431                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 30886                                  
 30887 00002B0B 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 30888 00002B0D 7523                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 30889                                  
 30890                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 30891                                  
 30892 00002B0F E8B000                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 30893 00002B12 721E                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 30894                                  
 30895 00002B14 E81601                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 30896                                  
 30897 00002B17 E8CE01                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 30898                                  
 30899                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 30900 00002B1A 2EFE06[681F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30901                                  
 30902 00002B1F AC                      	lodsb
 30903 00002B20 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 30904 00002B22 74C0                    	je	short pl10	;
 30905                                  
 30906 00002B24 E82200                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 30907 00002B27 7414                    	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 30908                                  
 30909 00002B29 E81200                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 30910 00002B2C 740E                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 30911                                  
 30912                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 30913 00002B2E 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 30914 00002B30 740A                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 30915                                  plE1:	
 30916                                  	;mov	ax,1
 30917 00002B32 B80100                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 30918 00002B35 4E                      	dec	si
 30919 00002B36 F9                      	stc
 30920 00002B37 C3                      	retn
 30921                                  
 30922                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 30923 00002B38 B80200                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 30924                                  	; 12/12/2022
 30925                                  	; cf=1
 30926                                  	;stc
 30927 00002B3B C3                      	retn
 30928                                  plSwX:	
 30929 00002B3C 4E                      	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 30930                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 30931                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 30932                                  	; cf=0
 30933                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 30934 00002B3D C3                      	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 30935

 30961                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30962                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 30963                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30964                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 30965                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 30966                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30967                                  ; USES:     ZF
 30968                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30969                                  
 30970                                  isEOL:
 30971 00002B3E 3C00                    	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 30972 00002B40 7406                    	je	short ieX
 30973 00002B42 3C0D                    	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 30974 00002B44 7402                    	je	short ieX
 30975 00002B46 3C0A                    	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 30976                                  ieX:	
 30977 00002B48 C3                      	retn
 30978                                  
 30979                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30980                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 30981                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30982                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 30983                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 30984                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30985                                  ; USES:     ZF
 30986                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30987                                  
 30988                                  isWhite:
 30989 00002B49 3C20                    	cmp	al,' '		; Space
 30990 00002B4B 7406                    	je	short iwX
 30991 00002B4D 3C3D                    	cmp	al,'='		; Equals (treat as whitespace)
 30992 00002B4F 7402                    	je	short iwX
 30993 00002B51 3C09                    	cmp	al,tab ; 9	; Tab
 30994                                  iwX:	
 30995 00002B53 C3                      	retn

 31048                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31049                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 31050                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 31051                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 31052                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 31053                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31054                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 31055                                  ; EXIT:     None
 31056                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 31057                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31058                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31059                                  
 31060                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31061                                  stowUMB:

 31107                                  	;jz	short su30	; means an error.

 31124                                  %if 0

 31159                                  %endif
 31160                                  
 31161                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31162                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 31163                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 31164                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 31165                                  ; A-F are considered valid iff gnradix is 16.
 31166                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31167                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 31168                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 31169                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 31170                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 31171                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31172                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 31173                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 31174                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 31175                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31176                                  
 31177                                  gnradix:
 31178 00002B8C 0000                    	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 31179                                  
 31180                                  toDigit:
 31181 00002B8E 2E833E[8C2B]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 31182 00002B94 751C                    	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 31183                                  
 31184                                  toDigit_hex:
 31185 00002B96 80F961                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 31186 00002B99 7209                    	jb	short td10
 31187 00002B9B 80F966                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 31188 00002B9E 7720                    	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'z' at all...
 31189 00002BA0 80E957                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 31190                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 31191 00002BA3 C3                      	retn
 31192                                  td10:	
 31193 00002BA4 80F941                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 31194 00002BA7 7209                    	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'?  Not a letter...
 31195 00002BA9 80F946                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 31196 00002BAC 7712                    	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'?  Not a digit.
 31197 00002BAE 80E937                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 31198                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 31199 00002BB1 C3                      	retn
 31200                                  toDigit_dec:
 31201                                  td20:	
 31202 00002BB2 80F930                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 31203                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 31204 00002BB5 720A                    	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 31205 00002BB7 80F939                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 31206 00002BBA 7704                    	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 31207 00002BBC 80E930                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 31208                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 31209 00002BBF C3                      	retn
 31210                                  tdE:	
 31211 00002BC0 F9                      	stc
 31212                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 31213 00002BC1 C3                      	retn
 31214                                  
 31215                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31216                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 31217                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31218                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 31219                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 31220                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 31221                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 31222                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31223                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 31224                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 31225                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 31226                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31227                                  
 31228                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31229                                  
 31230                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31231                                  ; (SYSINIT:3109h)
 31232                                  
 31233                                  GetXNum:
 31234                                  	;pushreg <bx, cx, ds>
 31235                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31236                                  	;push	bx
 31237 00002BC2 51                      	push	cx ; *
 31238                                  	;push	ds
 31239                                  
 31240 00002BC3 FC                      	cld
 31241 00002BC4 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 31242 00002BC6 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 31243 00002BC8 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 31244 00002BCA 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 31245                                  
 31246 00002BCC 2EC706[8C2B]0A00        	mov	word [cs:gnradix],10	; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 31247                                  
 31248 00002BD3 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]		; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 31249                                  	;call	toDigit
 31250 00002BD6 E8D9FF                  	call	toDigit_dec
 31251                                  	;jc	short gxnE		; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 31252                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31253 00002BD9 7233                    	jc	short gxnX
 31254                                  
 31255 00002BDB 08C9                    	or	cl,cl
 31256 00002BDD 7517                    	jnz	short gxn20		; Doesn't have '0x'
 31257 00002BDF 268A4C01                	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 31258 00002BE3 80F978                  	cmp	cl,'x'			; Either 'x'...
 31259 00002BE6 7405                    	je	short gxn10
 31260 00002BE8 80F958                  	cmp	cl,'X'			; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 31261 00002BEB 7509                    	jne	short gxn20
 31262                                  
 31263                                  gxn10:	
 31264 00002BED 2EC706[8C2B]1000        	mov	word [cs:gnradix], 16
 31265 00002BF4 46                      	inc	si			; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 31266 00002BF5 46                      	inc	si
 31267                                  
 31268                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 31269                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 31270                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 31271                                  ;        BX    = 0
 31272                                  ;        CH    = 0
 31273                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 31274                                  
 31275                                  gxn20:	
 31276 00002BF6 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 31277 00002BF9 46                      	inc	si
 31278                                  
 31279 00002BFA E891FF                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 31280 00002BFD 720D                    	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 31281                                  
 31282 00002BFF E80E00                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 31283 00002C02 720A                    	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 31284                                  
 31285 00002C04 01C8                    	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 31286 00002C06 11DA                    	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 iff last add wrapped
 31287                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 31288                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 31289 00002C08 73EC                    	jnc	short gxn20
 31290                                  gxnE:	
 31291                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 31292 00002C0A EB02                    	jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 31293                                  gxnQ:	
 31294 00002C0C 4E                      	dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 31295 00002C0D F8                      	clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 31296                                  gxnX:	
 31297                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31298                                  	;pop	ds
 31299 00002C0E 59                      	pop	cx ; *
 31300                                  	;pop	bx
 31301 00002C0F C3                      	retn
 31302                                  
 31303                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31304                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 31305                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31306                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 31307                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 31308                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 31309                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 31310                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31311                                  
 31312                                  mul32:
 31313 00002C10 50                      	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31314 00002C11 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31315 00002C13 2EF726[8C2B]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=?, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31316 00002C18 7211                    	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 31317                                  
 31318 00002C1A 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 31319 00002C1C 58                      	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 31320                                  
 31321 00002C1D 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 31322 00002C1F 2EF726[8C2B]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=carry,  AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 31323 00002C24 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 31324 00002C26 01DA                    	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 31325 00002C28 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 31326 00002C2A C3                      	retn
 31327                                  m32E:	
 31328 00002C2B 58                      	pop	ax
 31329 00002C2C C3                      	retn
 31330                                  
 31331                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31332                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)
 31333                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31334                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be divided
 31335                                  ; EXIT:    Interpereting DX:AX as bytes, AX=paragraph equivalent, 0xFFFF max
 31336                                  ; ERROR:   None
 31337                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 31338                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31339                                  ; Note: The 386 has a 32-bit SHR, which would work perfectly for this... but we
 31340                                  ;       can't ensure a 386 host machine. Sorry.
 31341                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31342                                  
 31343                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31344                                  toPara:
 31345 00002C2D 51                      	push	cx		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:LLLL llll llll llll
 31346                                  
 31347 00002C2E B104                    	mov	cl,4		;
 31348 00002C30 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:0000 LLLL llll llll
 31349 00002C32 92                      	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 31350 00002C33 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 31351 00002C35 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:hhhh 0000 0000 0000
 31352 00002C37 09D0                    	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll
 31353                                  
 31354 00002C39 59                      	pop	cx
 31355 00002C3A C3                      	retn

 31357                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31358                                  ;*** UmbHead - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 31359                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31360                                  ; ENTRY:  Nothing
 31361                                  ; EXIT:   AX contains 0x9FFF for most systems
 31362                                  ; ERROR:  Carry set if pointer is 0xFFFF (if not set up yet--DH runs into this)
 31363                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 31364                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31365                                  ; Early in the boot-cycle, the pointer used to obtain this value isn't set up;
 31366                                  ; to be precise, before a UMB provider is around. In this event, the pointer
 31367                                  ; is always set to 0xFFFF; it changes once a provider is around. On most
 31368                                  ; machines (all of 'em I've seen), it changes to 0x9FFF at that point.
 31369                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31370                                  
 31371                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31372                                  UmbHead:
 31373                                  	; 13/05/2019 (because of callers, pushs & pops are not needed here)
 31374                                  
 31375                                  	;push	si ; ?
 31376                                  	;push	ds ; ? 
 31377                                  	;push	es
 31378                                  	;push	bx ; *	
 31379                                  
 31380                                  	; 09/04/2019
 31381                                  	; !!! No need to save es,bx,ds,si above !!! (es,bx are changed here)
 31382                                  
 31383 00002C3B B452                    	mov	ah,GET_IN_VARS		; Call int 21h, function 52h...
 31384 00002C3D CD21                    	int	21h
 31385                                  
 31386 00002C3F 26A18C00                	mov	ax,[es:DOS_UMB_HEAD]	; And read what's in ES:[008C]
 31387                                  	
 31388                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31389 00002C43 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 31390 00002C46 F5                      	cmc
 31391                                  	; if AX=0FFFFh -> CF=1
 31392 00002C47 C3                      	retn
 31393                                  
 31394                                  ; 01/01/2023
 31395                                  ;%if 0
 31396                                  ;	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 31397                                  ;	je	short uhE		; If it's 0xFFFF, it's an error...
 31398                                  ;
 31399                                  ;	clc				; Else, it isn't (CLC done by prev cmp)
 31400                                  ;	;jmp	short uhX
 31401                                  ;	; 12/12/2022
 31402                                  ;	retn
 31403                                  ;uhE:	
 31404                                  ;	stc
 31405                                  ;uhX:

 31413                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31414                                  ;*** isSysMCB - sets ZF if ES points to an MCB owned by "SC" + (8 or 9)
 31415                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31416                                  ; ENTRY:  ES:0 should point to a valid MCB
 31417                                  ; EXIT:   ZF set if owned by SC+8 or SC+9 (for japan)
 31418                                  ; USES:   Flags
 31419                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31420                                  
 31421                                  isSysMCB:
 31422                                  	;push	ax
 31423                                  
 31424                                  	;mov	ax,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; Check the owner...
 31425                                  	;cmp	ax,SystemPSPOwner	; 8 (for US OR Japan) is valid
 31426                                  	;je	short ism10
 31427                                  	;cmp	ax,JapanPSPOwner	; 9 (for Japan) is valid
 31428                                  	;;je	short ism10
 31429                                  	;;jmp	short ismX		; Anything else isn't.
 31430                                  	;jne	short ismX
 31431 00002C48 26833E010008            	cmp	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],SystemPSPOwner ; 8  ; 09/04/2019
 31432 00002C4E 7507                    	jne	short ismX 
 31433                                  ism10:	
 31434                                  	;mov	ax,[es:ARENA.NAME]	; Check the name...
 31435                                  	;cmp	ax,'SC' ; 4353h
 31436 00002C50 26813E08005343          	cmp	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC'
 31437                                  ismX:	
 31438                                  	;pop	ax
 31439 00002C57 C3                      	retn

 31441                                  ; 09/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31442                                  
 31443                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31444                                  ;*** AddrToUmb - converts a segment address in AX to its appropriate UMB number
 31445                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31446                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a segment address
 31447                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain the UMB number which contains the address (0==conv)
 31448                                  ; ERROR:  If the address is above UM Range, AX will return as FFFF.
 31449                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 31450                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31451                                  ; An address in the following areas is treated as:
 31452                                  ;    0      <-> umbhead (0x9FFF)          = Conventional memory
 31453                                  ;    0x9FFF <-> addr of first UM sys MCB  = UMB #1
 31454                                  ;      ...
 31455                                  ;    addr of last UM sys MCB <-> TOM      = invalid; returns #0xFFFF
 31456                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31457                                  
 31458                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31459                                  AddrToUmb:
 31460                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31461                                  	;push	cx
 31462                                  	;push	dx
 31463 00002C58 06                      	push	es
 31464                                  
 31465 00002C59 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX = address to search for
 31466                                  
 31467 00002C5B E8DDFF                  	call	UmbHead		; AX = first segment
 31468 00002C5E 7222                    	jc	short atuE	; If it couldn't get it, error out.
 31469                                  
 31470                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31471                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *	; ES = first UMB segment
 31472 00002C60 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; 0	; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now... (cx = UMB#)
 31473                                  
 31474                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31475                                  atu10:
 31476 00002C62 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax ; * ; ** ; 22/07/2023
 31477                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 31478                                  ; ATU10--ES - Current MCB address
 31479                                  ;        DX - Address given for conversion
 31480                                  ;        CX - Current UMB #
 31481                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 31482                                  
 31483                                  ;atu10:	
 31484                                  	;mov	ax,es ; * ; 18/07/2023
 31485 00002C64 39D0                            cmp	ax,dx		; Present segment >= given segment?
 31486 00002C66 731D                    	jae	short atuX	; Yep--done.
 31487                                  
 31488 00002C68 E8DDFF                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if this is a system MCB
 31489 00002C6B 7501                    	jnz	short atu20
 31490                                  
 31491 00002C6D 41                      	inc	cx		; If it _was_ a system MCB, we're in a new UMB.
 31492                                  atu20:	
 31493                                  	;mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 31494                                  	;cmp	al,arena_signature_end  ; 'Z'
 31495                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31496                                  	; ax = es
 31497                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 31498 00002C6E 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 31499 00002C73 26803E00005A            	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end
 31500 00002C79 7403                    	je	short atu30		; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 31501                                  
 31502                                  	;NextMCB es,ax
 31503                                  
 31504                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 31505                                  	;;add	ax,[es:3]
 31506                                  	;add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 31507 00002C7B 40                      	inc	ax
 31508                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31509                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *
 31510 00002C7C EBE4                    	jmp	short atu10
 31511                                  
 31512                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31513                                  ; if we get to atu30, they specified a number that was past the last MCB.
 31514                                  ; make sure it's not _inside_ that MCB before we return an error condition.
 31515                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31516                                  
 31517                                  atu30:	
 31518                                  	; 22/07/2023
 31519                                  	; ax = es + [es:ARENA.SIZE] 
 31520                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 31521                                  	;add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE] ; **
 31522 00002C7E 39D0                    	cmp	ax,dx		; Present >= given?
 31523 00002C80 7303                    	jae	short atuX	; Yep! It _was_ inside.
 31524                                  atuE:	
 31525 00002C82 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; 0	; Else, fall through with UMB # == -1
 31526 00002C84 49                      	dec	cx		; (that makes it return 0xFFFF and sets CF)
 31527                                  atuX:	
 31528 00002C85 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx		; Return the UMB number in AX
 31529                                  	
 31530 00002C87 07                      	pop	es	
 31531                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31532                                  	;pop	dx
 31533                                  	;pop	cx
 31534 00002C88 C3                      	retn
 31535                                  
 31536                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31537                                  ;*** convUMB - checks after GetXNum to convert an address to a UMB number
 31538                                  ;            -- if GetXNum read a hex number, we interperete that as a segment
 31539                                  ; address rather than a UMB number... and use that address to look up a UMB.
 31540                                  ; This routine checks for that condition and calls AddrToUmb if necessary.
 31541                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31542                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a UMB number or segment, gnradix has been set by GetXNum
 31543                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain a UMB number
 31544                                  ; ERROR:  None
 31545                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 31546                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31547                                  
 31548                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31549                                  convUMB:
 31550 00002C89 2E833E[8C2B]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 31551 00002C8F 7507                    	jne	short cu10	; If it didn't read in hex, it's not an address
 31552 00002C91 E8C4FF                  	call	AddrToUmb	; Else, convert the address to a UMB number
 31553                                  	;cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 31554                                  	;jne	short cu10
 31555                                  	;inc	ax		; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 31556                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31557 00002C94 40                      	inc	ax
 31558 00002C95 7401                    	jz	short cu10	; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 31559 00002C97 48                      	dec	ax
 31560                                  cu10:	
 31561 00002C98 C3                      	retn
 31562                                  
 31563                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31564                                  ;%if 0
 31565                                  ;
 31566                                  ;; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31567                                  ;;*** setUMBs - links umbs and sets allocation strategy for a load
 31568                                  ;;            -- if LoadHigh, the allocation strategy MAY be LOW_FIRST instead
 31569                                  ;; of the usual HIGH_FIRST. See the code.
 31570                                  ;; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31571                                  ;; ENTRY:  None
 31572                                  ;; EXIT:   None
 31573                                  ;; ERROR:  None
 31574                                  ;; USES:   Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 31575                                  ;; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31576                                  ;

 31587                                  ; 18/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 31588                                  ; loadLow subroutine is not used anywhere of IO.SYS 6.22 (& 5.0)
 31589                                  %if 0
 31590                                  
 31591                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31592                                  ;*** loadLow - returns AL==0 if UMB0 == 0, else AL==1
 31593                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31594                                  ; ENTRY:  None
 31595                                  ; EXIT:   AL==0 if mem strategy should be set to LOW_FIRST, else AL==1
 31596                                  ;         Carry set if UMB0 not specified (_NOT_ an error)
 31597                                  ; ERROR:  None
 31598                                  ; USES:   Flags, fm_strat, fm_umb
 31599                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31600                                  ; We want to set the memory strategy to LOW_FIRST if the user specified a
 31601                                  ; load UMB, and it is 0. That 0 can be either from the user having _specified_
 31602                                  ; zero (/L:0;...), or from having specified a too-big min size (/L:1,99999999)
 31603                                  ; such that the load UMB is too small, and shouldn't be used.
 31604                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31605                                  
 31606                                  loadLow:
 31607                                  	;push	ds
 31608                                  	;push	cs		; Point DS into appropriate data segment
 31609                                  	;pop	ds	
 31610                                  
 31611                                  	;mov	al,[UmbLoad]
 31612                                  	mov	al,[cs:UmbLoad]
 31613                                  	cmp	al,UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh, -1
 31614                                  	jne	short ll10
 31615                                  
 31616                                  	stc
 31617                                  ll15:

 32098                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32099                                  ;*** findUMB - makes ES:0 point to the first MCB in UMB given as AL
 32100                                  ;            -- returns UmbHEAD pointer (0x9FFF) if passed AL==0
 32101                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32102                                  ; ENTRY:    AL should be to a valid UMB number
 32103                                  ; EXIT:     ES:0 points to first MCB in UMB (_not_ the 8+SC MCB that heads it)
 32104                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if couldn't reach UMB (too high)
 32105                                  ; USES:     Flags, ES
 32106                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32107                                  
 32108                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 32109                                  	; (SYSINIT:3344h)
 32110                                  findUMB:
 32111                                  	; 01/01/2023
 32112                                  	;push	ax
 32113                                  	; 02/01/2023
 32114 00002D61 51                      	push	cx ; *
 32115                                  	;push	dx
 32116                                  
 32117 00002D62 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah		; Zap ah, so al==ax
 32118                                  
 32119 00002D64 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; Store the to-be-found UMB number in DX
 32120                                  
 32121 00002D66 E8D2FE                  	call	UmbHead		; Returns first UMB segment in AX
 32122                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32123                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *
 32124 00002D69 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx		; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now...
 32125                                  
 32126                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32127                                  fu10:
 32128 00002D6B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax ; * ; **
 32129                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 32130                                  ; FU10--CX - This UMB number; 0 == conventional
 32131                                  ;       DX - The UMB number they're looking for
 32132                                  ;       ES - The current MCB address
 32133                                  ; ---------------------------------------------
 32134                                  
 32135                                  ;fu10:	
 32136 00002D6D 39D1                    	cmp	cx,dx		; If CX==DX, we've found the UMB we're
 32137 00002D6F 7417                    	je	short fuX	; searching for--so exit.
 32138                                  
 32139 00002D71 E8D4FE                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if owner is SYSTEM
 32140 00002D74 7501                    	jnz	short fu20
 32141                                  
 32142 00002D76 41                      	inc	cx		; If it _was_ SYSTEM, we're in a new UMB.
 32143                                  fu20:	
 32144                                  	;mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 32145                                  	;cmp	al,arena_signature_end ; 'Z'
 32146                                  	; 19/07/2023
 32147 00002D77 26803E00005A            	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end 
 32148 00002D7D 7408                    	je	short fuE	; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 32149                                  
 32150                                  	;NextMCB es,ax		; Go on forward.
 32151                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32152                                  	; ax = es

 32156 00002D84 40                      	inc	ax
 32157                                  	; 22/07/2023
 32158                                  	;mov	es,ax ; **
 32159 00002D85 EBE4                    	jmp	short fu10
 32160                                  fuE:	
 32161 00002D87 F9                      	stc
 32162                                  fuX:

 32164                                  	;pop	dx
