 35230                                  
 35231                                  ;	two sided drives have two special cases to look for. One is
 35232                                  ;	   a 320K diskette (40 tracks, 8 secs per track). It uses
 35233                                  ;	   a mediaid of 0fch. The other is 1.44M, which uses only
 35234                                  ;	   one sector/cluster.
 35235                                  
 35236                                  ;	any drive with 18secs/trk, 2 heads, 80 tracks, will be assumed
 35237                                  ;	   to be a 1.44M and use only 1 sector per cluster. Any other
 35238                                  ;	   type of 2 headed drive is all set.

 35243 00003635 7502                    	jne	short not_144m
 35244

 35246                                  
 35247 00003637 EB24                    	jmp	short got_one_secperclus_drive

 35249                                  ;	check for 320K

 35846                                  ;
 35847                                  ; procedure : skip_comment
 35848                                  ;
 35849                                  ;skip the commented string until lf, if current es:si-> a comment string.
 35850                                  ;in) es:si-> string
 35851                                  ;	 cx -> length.
 35852                                  ;out) zero flag not set if not found a comment string.
 35853                                  ;	  zero flag set if found a comment string and skipped it. al will contain
 35854                                  ;	  the line feed character at this moment when return.
 35855                                  ;	  ax register destroyed.
 35856                                  ;	  if found, si, cx register adjusted accordingly.
 35857                                  ;
 35858                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35859                                  
 35860                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retrodos v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 35861                                  	; (SYSINIT:428Dh)
 35862

 35865                                  
 35866                                  	; 03/01/2023
 35867                                  	; ds = cs	
 35868                                  
 35869 0000387F 803E[5003]00            	cmp	byte [com_level],0
 35870                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:com_level],0 ; only check it if parameter level is 0.
 35871 00003884 752C                    	jne	short no_commt	 ; (not inside quotations)
 35872                                  
 35873 00003886 803E[5103]01            	cmp	byte [cmmt],1
 35874                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],1
 35875 0000388B 7225                    	jb	short no_commt
 35876                                  
 35877 0000388D 268A04                  	mov	al,[es:si]
 35878                                  	
 35879 00003890 3806[5203]              	cmp	[cmmt1],al
 35880                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt1],al
 35881 00003894 751C                    	jne	short no_commt
 35882                                  
 35883 00003896 803E[5103]02            	cmp	byte [cmmt],2
 35884                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],2
 35885 0000389B 750A                    	jne	short skip_cmmt
 35886                                  
 35887 0000389D 268A4401                	mov	al,[es:si+1]
 35888                                  	
 35889 000038A1 3806[5303]              	cmp	[cmmt2],al
 35890                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt2],al

 35892                                  skip_cmmt:

 35911                                  ;
 35912                                  ;   kbd_read: wait for keystroke
 35913                                  ;
 35914                                  ;   INPUT
 35915                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 35916                                  ;
 35917                                  ;   OUTPUT
 35918                                  ;       Carry SET to clean boot, CLEAR otherwise
 35919                                  ;
 35920                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 35921                                  ;       All
 35922                                  ;
 35923                                  ;   HISTORY
 35924                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 35925                                  ;
 35926                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35927                                  
 35928                                  kbd_read:
 35929 000038B3 F606[1047]02                    test    byte [bDisableUI],2
 35930 000038B8 7520                            jnz     short kbd_nodelay
 35931                                  
 35932 000038BA 1E                              push    ds              ; the bios timer tick count is incremented
 35933 000038BB 29C0                            sub     ax,ax           ; 18.2 times per second;
 35934 000038BD 8ED8                            mov     ds,ax           ; watch the timer tick count for 37 transitions
 35935                                  	;mov	dx,[046Ch]	; get initial value
 35936                                  kbd_loop:
 35937 000038BF B401                            mov     ah,1            ;
 35938 000038C1 CD16                            int     16h             ; peek the keyboard
 35939 000038C3 7514                            jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; something's there, get out
 35940 000038C5 B402                            mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 35941 000038C7 CD16                            int     16h             ;
 35942 000038C9 A803                            test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 35943 000038CB 750C                            jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; yes
 35944 000038CD A16C04                          mov     ax,[046Ch]	;
 35945                                  	;sub	ax,dx           ; get difference
 35946                                  	; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35947 000038D0 2E2B06[8603]            	sub	ax,[cs:_timer_lw_] ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:42E5h        
 35948                                  
 35949 000038D5 3C25                    	cmp     al,37           ; reached limit?  ; (2 seconds)
 35950 000038D7 72E6                            jb	short kbd_loop	; not yet
 35951                                  kbd_loopdone:
 35952 000038D9 1F                              pop     ds              ; delay complete!
 35953                                  kbd_nodelay:
 35954 000038DA 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; assume clean boot
 35955 000038DC B402                            mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 35956 000038DE CD16                            int     16h             ;
 35957 000038E0 A803                            test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 35958 000038E2 7407                            jz      short kbd_notshift ; no
 35959 000038E4 43                              inc     bx              ; yes
 35960 000038E5 43                              inc     bx
 35961                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4301h
 35962 000038E6 800E[1447]04            	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4
 35963                                  kbd_notshift:                   ;
 35964 000038EB B401                            mov     ah,1            ; peek the keyboard
 35965 000038ED CD16                            int     16h             ;
 35966 000038EF 743E                            jz	short kbd_test	; no key present
 35967 000038F1 08C0                            or      al,al           ; is it a function key?
 35968 000038F3 753A                            jnz	short kbd_test	; no
 35969                                  
 35970                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:430Bh
 35971 000038F5 80FC62                          cmp     ah,62h          ; CTRL F5
 35972 000038F8 7405                            je	short kbd_cfg_bypass
 35973                                  	
 35974 000038FA 80FC3F                          cmp     ah,3Fh          ; F5 function key?
 35975 000038FD 750D                            jne	short kbd_notf5	; no
 35976                                  kbd_cfg_bypass:
 35977 000038FF BA[A74B]                        mov     dx,_$CleanMsg
 35978 00003902 E8DD0B                          call    print
 35979                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:431Bh
 35980 00003905 800E[1447]04            	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4 
 35981 0000390A EB16                            jmp     short kbd_eat   ; yes, clean boot selected
 35982                                  kbd_notf5:
 35983                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4322h
 35984 0000390C 80FC65                          cmp     ah,65h          ; CTRL F8
 35985 0000390F 7405                            je	short kbd_cfg_confirm
 35986                                  
 35987 00003911 80FC42                          cmp     ah,42h          ; F8 function key?
 35988 00003914 7523                            jne	short kbd_exit	; no
 35989                                  kbd_cfg_confirm:
 35990 00003916 BA[E54B]                        mov     dx,_$InterMsg
 35991 00003919 E8C60B                          call    print           ;
 35992 0000391C B301                            mov     bl,1            ; yes, interactive-boot option enabled
 35993 0000391E 881E[1447]                      mov     [bQueryOpt],bl  ; change default setting
 35994                                  kbd_eat:                        ;
 35995 00003922 B400                            mov     ah,0            ;
 35996 00003924 CD16                            int     16h             ; eat the key we assumed was a signal
 35997 00003926 C606[1A47]FF                    mov	byte [secElapsed],-1
 35998 0000392B 09DB                            or      bx,bx           ;
 35999 0000392D 7405                            jz	short kbd_clean	;
 36000                                  kbd_test:                       ;
 36001 0000392F 80FB02                          cmp     bl,2            ;
 36002 00003932 7205                            jb	short kbd_exit	;
 36003                                  kbd_clean:                      ;
 36004 00003934 E86E08                          call    disable_autoexec; yes, tell COMMAND to skip autoexec.bat
 36005 00003937 F9                              stc                     ; set carry to indicate abort
 36006 00003938 C3                              retn			;
 36007                                  kbd_exit:                       ;
 36008 00003939 F8                              clc                     ; clear carry to indicate success
 36009 0000393A C3                              retn			;

 36013                                  ;   set_numlock: set numlock LED
 36014                                  ;
 36015                                  ;   INPUT
 36016                                  ;       ES:SI -> numlock setting (ie, "ON" or "OFF")
 36017                                  ;
 36018                                  ;   OUTPUT
 36019                                  ;       None
 36020                                  ;
 36021                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 36022                                  ;       None
 36023                                  ;
 36024                                  ;   HISTORY
 36025                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 36026                                  ;

 36028                                  
 36029                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 36030                                  
 36031                                  set_numlock:
 36032                                          ; 04/01/2023
 36033                                  	;push	ax
 36034 0000393B 1E                              push    ds
 36035 0000393C 29C0                            sub     ax,ax
 36036 0000393E 8ED8                            mov     ds,ax
 36037 00003940 268B04                          mov     ax,[es:si]      ; get 1st 2 bytes of value (ON or OF)
 36038 00003943 2E3B06[824B]                    cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff+2]	; should we turn it off?
 36039 00003948 7507                            jne	short not_off	; no
 36040 0000394A 80261704DF                      and     byte [0417h],~20h ; 0DFh
 36041 0000394F EB0D                            jmp     short set_done
 36042                                  not_off:
 36043 00003951 2E3B06[804B]                    cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff]	; should we turn it on?
 36044 00003956 F9                              stc
 36045 00003957 7505                            jne	short set_done	; no
 36046 00003959 800E170420                      or      byte [0417h],20h
 36047                                  set_done:
 36048 0000395E 1F                              pop     ds
 36049                                  	; 04/01/2023
 36050                                  	;pop	ax
 36051 0000395F C3                              retn

 36054                                  
 36055                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36056                                  ;
 36057                                  ;   menu_check:  check for presence of menu (and other) configuration blocks
 36058                                  ;
 36059                                  ;   INPUT
 36060                                  ;       CX == "organized" config.sys memory image length
 36061                                  ;    ES:SI -> "organized" config.sys memory image
 36062                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 36063                                  ;
 36064                                  ;   OUTPUT
 36065                                  ;       Same as above; the idea is that menu_check simply transforms
 36066                                  ;       a block-structured config.sys image into a conventional image,
 36067                                  ;       based on the user's block selection and any other boot-time options
 36068                                  ;       the user may have employed...
 36069                                  ;
 36070                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 36071                                  ;       All
 36072                                  ;
 36073                                  ;   NOTES
 36074                                  ;       [count] and [org_count] are set to the new config.sys image length
 36075                                  ;
 36076                                  ;   HISTORY
 36077                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 36078                                  ;
 36079                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36080                                  
 36081                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retrodos v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 36082                                  	; (SYSINIT:4378h)
 36083                                  
 36084                                  menu_check:
 36085                                  
 36086                                  ;   Search for SWITCHES, determine if /N or /F are present; if so, then
 36087                                  ;   disable clean/interactive boot options
 36088                                  
 36089 00003960 51                              push    cx              ;
 36090 00003961 56                              push    si              ;
 36091 00003962 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; remains ZERO until first block
 36092                                  swchk_loop:                     ;
 36093 00003964 E83507                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 36094 00003967 724C                            jc	short swchk_end	; hit eof
 36095 00003969 3C5B                            cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; '['
 36096 0000396B 7503                            jne	short swchk_next1 ;
 36097 0000396D 43                              inc     bx              ; remember that we've seen a block
 36098 0000396E EB40                            jmp     short swchk_nextline
 36099                                  swchk_next1:                    ;
 36100 00003970 3C4E                            cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 36101 00003972 750E                            jne	short swchk_next2 ;
 36102 00003974 09DB                            or      bx,bx           ; only do NUMLOCK commands that exist
 36103 00003976 7538                            jnz	short swchk_nextline ; before the first block
 36104 00003978 E8C0FF                          call    set_numlock     ; REM it out so we don't act on it later, too
 36105 0000397B 26C644FF30                      mov     byte [es:si-1],CONFIG_REM
 36106 00003980 EB2E                            jmp     short swchk_nextline
 36107                                  swchk_next2:                    ;
 36108 00003982 3C31                            cmp     al,CONFIG_SWITCHES
 36109 00003984 752A                            jne	short swchk_nextline ; this line ain't it
 36110                                  swchk_scan:                     ;
 36111 00003986 E81307                          call    get_char        ; look for /N or /F
 36112                                  swchk_scan1:                    ;
 36113 00003989 3C0A                            cmp     al,LF           ; end of line?
 36114 0000398B 7423                            je	short swchk_nextline ; yes
 36115 0000398D 3C2F                            cmp     al,'/'          ; switch-char?
 36116 0000398F 75F5                            jne	short swchk_scan ; no
 36117 00003991 E80807                          call    get_char        ;

 36119 00003996 3A06[C51E]                      cmp     al,[swit_n+1]	; 'N'

 36121 0000399C 800E[1047]01                    or      byte [bDisableUI],1
 36122 000039A1 EBE3                            jmp	short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 36123                                  swchk_scan2:                    ;

 36139 000039BC 7508                            jnz	short menu_search

 36166 000039DA E89E06                  	call	get_number	; get first number

 36168 000039E0 88DD                    	mov	ch,bl           ; save it in CH
 36169                                  	; 01/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization) by Erdogan Tan 
 36170                                  	; (high nibble of dl is 0)
 36171                                  	;and	dl,0F0h	; !*!	; (low nibble of dl would be zero)
 36172                                  	;or	dl,bl		; (low nibble of dl is 7) ! 14/08/2023

 36174 000039E4 E83108                  	call	delim           ; did we hit a delimiter
 36175 000039E7 750E                    	jne	short check_color ; no, all done
 36176 000039E9 E88F06                  	call	get_number	; get next number
 36177 000039EC 80E30F                  	and	bl,0Fh		; second # is background color (for high nibble)
 36178 000039EF 88DE                    	mov	dh,bl           ; save it in DH

 36182 000039F3 D2E3                    	shl	bl,cl           ;
 36183 000039F5 08DA                    	or	dl,bl           ;

 36186 000039F9 7503                    	jne	short set_color	; no
 36187 000039FB 80F208                  	xor	dl,08h          ; yes, so modify the fgnd intensity

 36211

 36232 00003A47 F9                              stc                     ;

 36235                                  menu_numlock:

 36240                                  
 36241                                  ;   Save the offset of the default block name, we'll need it later
 36242                                  
 36243                                  menu_default:

 36245 00003A58 803E[1A47]00                    cmp     byte [secElapsed],0

 36254                                  	;jb	short timeout_ok ; (besides, 99 is the largest # my simple
 36255 00003A71 7602                            jna	short timeout_ok ; 01/08/2023
 36256 00003A73 B35A                    	mov     bl,90           ;  display function can handle)

 36261                                  
 36262                                  ;   Verify that this is a valid menu item by searching for the named block

 36264                                  menu_item:

 36274

 36281 00003A8E 89D3                            mov     bx,dx           ; and use it to index the arrays of offsets

 36302                                  
 36303                                  ;   Display menu items now, after determining which one is default
 36304                                  
 36305                                  menu_getdefault:
 36306 00003AB6 08D2                            or      dl,dl           ; where there any valid blocks at all?
 36307 00003AB8 7505                            jnz	short menu_valid ; yes
 36308 00003ABA 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; no, so force autoselect of 0
 36309 00003ABC E9ED00                          jmp     menu_autoselect ; (meaning: process common blocks only)
 36310                                  menu_valid:

 36313 00003AC5 8B3E[1747]                      mov     di,[offDefBlock];
 36314 00003AC9 09FF                            or      di,di           ; does a default block exist?
 36315 00003ACB 741C                            jz	short menu_nodefault ; no

 36317                                  menu_chkdefault:
 36318 00003ACE 53                              push    bx              ;
 36319 00003ACF 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ;
 36320 00003AD1 8BB7[2547]                      mov     si,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 36321 00003AD5 B98000                          mov     cx,128          ; arbitrary maximum length of a name
 36322 00003AD8 1E                              push    ds              ;
 36323 00003AD9 06                              push    es              ;
 36324 00003ADA 1F                              pop     ds              ;

 36332                                  menu_nodefault:

 36334                                  menu_setdefault:
 36335 00003AEB 881E[1547]                      mov     [bDefBlock],bl  ; yes, this will be the initial current block
 36336                                  
 36337                                  ;   If the timeout was explicitly set to 0 (or technically, anything that
 36338                                  ;   failed to resolve to a number, like "NONE" or "EAT POTATOES"), then we're
 36339                                  ;   supposed to skip menu display and run with the specified default block;
 36340                                  ;   however, if the user hit Enter prior to boot, thereby requesting fully
 36341                                  ;   INTERACTIVE boot, then we shall display the menu block anyway (though still
 36342                                  ;   with no timeout)

 36356 00003B06 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 36357 00003B08 06                              push    es              ;
 36358 00003B09 B84000                          mov     ax,40h          ; reach down into the ROM BIOS data area
 36359 00003B0C 8EC0                            mov     es,ax           ; and save the current (default) video page
 36360 00003B0E 26A14E00                        mov     ax,[es:004Eh]   ; start address and page #, in case the

 36369                                          ;mov	dl,[es:CRT_Cols]

 36371 00003B2F FECA                    	dec     dl              ;
 36372                                          ;mov	dh,[es:CRT_Rows];
 36373 00003B31 268A368400                      mov	dh,[es:84h]
 36374 00003B36 08F6                    	or      dh,dh           ; # of rows valid?
 36375 00003B38 7504                            jnz	short menu_clear ; hopefully
 36376 00003B3A 8A36[0F47]                      mov     dh,[bLastRow]   ; no, use a default
 36377                                  menu_clear:

 36379 00003B40 07                              pop     es              ;
 36380 00003B41 8836[0F47]                      mov     [bLastRow],dh   ; save DH
 36381 00003B45 BA[224C]                        mov     dx,_$MenuHeader

 36383                                  
 36384 00003B4B F606[1047]01                    test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 36385 00003B50 751F                            jnz     short menu_nostatus
 36386 00003B52 8A3E[0C47]                      mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ;

 36388 00003B5A B200                            mov     dl,0            ; print the status line on row DH, col 0,
 36389 00003B5C B402                            mov     ah,02h          ; now that we can trash the cursor position
 36390 00003B5E CD10                            int     10h             ;
 36391 00003B60 BA[6E4C]                        mov     dx,_$StatusLine
 36392 00003B63 E87C09                          call    print           ;
 36393 00003B66 B403                            mov     ah,3            ; get cursor position
 36394 00003B68 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 36395 00003B6A 80EA02                          sub     dl,2            ;
 36396 00003B6D 8816[0E47]                      mov     [bLastCol],dl   ; save column where status char will go
 36397                                  
 36398                                  menu_nostatus:
 36399 00003B71 BB0100                          mov     bx,1            ; now prepare to display all the menu items
 36400                                  menu_disploop:
 36401 00003B74 E8B002                          call    print_item	; print item #BL
 36402 00003B77 43                              inc     bx              ; why "inc bx"? because it's a 1-byte opcode
 36403 00003B78 3A1E[1647]                      cmp     bl,[bMaxBlock]  ; all done?
 36404 00003B7C 76F6                            jbe	short menu_disploop ; not yet
 36405                                  
 36406                                  ;   Set cursor position to just below the menu items
 36407                                  
 36408 00003B7E B200                            mov     dl,0            ; select column
 36409 00003B80 88DE                            mov     dh,bl           ;

 36411 00003B85 8A3E[0C47]                      mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ;

 36414

 36423 00003BA8 8F06[1047]                      pop     word [bDisableUI]
 36424                                  
 36425                                  ;   Now begins the "re-organization" process...
 36426                                  
 36427                                  menu_autoselect:

 36431                                  menu_abort:

 36435                                  normal_boot:

 36437 00003BBC 7509                            jne	short not_topmenu ; no

 36439 00003BC2 29F6                            sub     si,si           ;

 36441                                  
 36442                                  not_topmenu:
 36443 00003BC7 80BF[1B47]4F                    cmp     byte [abBlockType+bx],CONFIG_SUBMENU
 36444 00003BCC 7510                            jne	short not_submenu
 36445 00003BCE 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ;
 36446 00003BD0 8BBF[2547]                      mov     di,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 36447 00003BD4 E8E101                          call    srch_block      ; THIS CANNOT FAIL!
 36448 00003BD7 89FE                            mov     si,di           ;
 36449 00003BD9 89D9                            mov     cx,bx           ; ES:SI and CX are ready for another round
 36450 00003BDB E929FE                          jmp     menu_found
 36451                                  
 36452                                  not_submenu:
 36453 00003BDE 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ; get BX -> name of selected block
 36454 00003BE0 8B9F[2547]                      mov     bx,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 36455                                  
 36456                                  ;   BX should now either be ZERO (meaning no block has been selected) or
 36457                                  ;   the offset relative to ES of the block name to be processed (along with
 36458                                  ;   all the "common" lines of course)
 36459
